description:
My family loves to eat here. The burgers and fries are so yummy and we always, always, always, finish off with delicious milkshakes. 

Kid friendly and the staff is very kind. Parking is metered but if you look around, you may find street parking.
author: Chris H.

description:
I can't in good conscience give this a better review than 2 stars. 

It cost above than average but food are average at best.
author: U L.

description:
After years of not going to Tower due to mediocre food, I decided to give it another chance when a friend mentioned it.

Pros: location, ample parking, casual interior, hamburger is okay, maybe a little greasy.

Cons: Worst chili ever made (no flavor, no cheese - cheese apparently costs extra which is strange since it's chili), salad isn't chopped to bite sized pieces and is expensive, owners aren't very welcoming.

That was the last time for me. Hopefully they make better food in the future and greet their customers.
author: M K.

description:
Came here last Tuesday around 8pm for a quick bite.  It was highly recommended by one of my husbands patient.   The place was very spacious.  Not busy when we came.  It seems like the place is family owned.

Our order was taken immediately.

We ordered:
3 pieces fish and chips 
Tower burger
Anchor steam.  

Fish was Cod,  really bland, no flavor. I was really disappointed.  It also came with cole slaw which I really didn't care for. 

Tower burger came with bacon, grilled onion, sautéed mushroom, pickles and your choice of cheese (we picked provolone)- we ordered it to be cooked medium rare, it was juicy and my husband enjoyed it.

I can prolly find a better restaurant for fish and chips in the city.
author: Junaline G.

description: Hawaiian burger and fish and chips was our order. Overall the food was excellent. Everything was fresh, very well portioned and flavorful. Our order was done fast, plenty of sitting areas, great location, everything was clean and excellent customer service.
author: Nicho S.

description: Solid Mom and Pop joint that does everything good but nothing great. I eat here periodically because its conveinient when I am teaching. I usually get the bacon burger and it is good. The fish n chips are good and so is the Cobb salad. The have good service and fresh food, just nothing spectacular. Good prices and a clean restaurant are consistent here.
author: Jay H.

description:
Yummy fish and chips ....
Oh wash it down with an Anchor...
How wonderful...

Burgers, fish and chips, big space.
Close to twin peaks, up the hill from almost anywhere in sf.
author: Matt J.

description:
Had to gently remind the owner to wash her hands after processing payment, before making my daughter's milkshake. She argued that she wasn't going to touch any of the ingredients. Again I asked her to wash her hands. Really??

Burgers are terrible, sadly, as are salads. Fries and onion rings are good.

As a nurse, I gotta say, hand washing is big in my book. I won't be back.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
FYI  it is unfortunate this proprietor doesn't understand how a closing time works. 30 minutes before closing they will refuse to let you dine in but they will make your order if you will accept it to go only. When I took a burger three blocks home in a to-go box, I found it swimming inside the box with the bun inedible.
.
For the life of me I can't understand why the burgers are so incredibly greasy. Others may say they're just juicy but in any case they're very messy to eat. 
.
I don't like seeing they don't separate recycling from garbage, I wish they were more conscientious.
.
$7.95 Hawaiian Burger with $3.65 side of regular Fries.
author: Caesar A.

description: I ordered the classic American cheese, white bread grilled cheese and tomato sandwich, expecting standard fare. Instead, it was the best of its kind. The bread was toasty and crunchy and the fresh tomato/melted cheese combo was delicious. The portion was just right - not some monstrosity with three kinds of strong cheeses and bread the size of a shoe. No, this grilled cheese sandwich rests on the pinnacle of perfection.
author: Priscilla O.

description: This burger was a little over salted and over cooked when I asked for medium. I also ordered fries and the serving was very small for an extra $2.99. I could live with the burger but the fries portion was a tease. You can do better guys...quit scrimping on the fries.
author: H L.

description: Great fantastic HUMANE juicy burgers! First off lets just say if you are a humane meat supporter this place is a must! They get their meat from Neman Ranch (however it is spelled) and the quality of meat is the absolute best. I ordered the Hawaiian burger and i love how the teriyaki sauce compliments the burger patty really well. Also toppled with a sweet cut of pineapple its a must! The french fries are alright. I find the texture slightly dry but nonetheless its not bad. In terms of pricing, its around 10 bucks with fries on average. Anyways i highly recommend this place and I am a regular here.
author: John M.

description:
We came here one evening for a simple dinner.  We had been here before but not in a long time.  We were greeted immediately by a young woman at the counter who took our order.
We sat at our table and in only five minutes, our meals were served.
I chose the Paris burger with French fries both of which were quite good. The lettuce, tomato and red onion were fresh and the meat was perfectly cooked medium.
My partner had a mix of fried seafood, French friends and coleslaw.  He liked everything and ate it all.
So, while there was nothing spectacular about our meals, they were good.
author: Philip C.

description:
The bacon cheeseburger I had was excellent after I removed some of the overflowing mayo from the top of the bun. 

The beef itself was good quality and cooked perfectly for a medium-well. The lettuce, tomato, and onion were all fresh.

The side of onion rings were also perfect for those who like true deep fried thick o rings.

The chocolate shake was small and disappointing while overpriced. 

I prefer burgermeister by a hair as I think it's a hair cheaper. The plus side of tower burger though is you should be able to get parking whereas parking near BM in cole valley can be impossible.

If I could give 3.5 stars I would.
author: David A.

description:
I came in the other night after a wax at Irina's Skincare (just around the corner to the right of Tower) and ordered dinner because it was about 2 hours later than I normally eat and I was ravenous.  

I ordered the 2-piece fish and chips and a beer to drink while I waited for my food.  The woman who took my order looked at me super cock-eyed in re the beer thing, and I recommend she just let me live my life.  

When I got home and took the first bite of the fish, it tasted fantastic because I was starving and slightly buzzed. But a few bites later I realized that everything was just OK.  I don't think the fish is cod, which really gets me down on fish and chips.  Not sure what it was, but it was a thinner, softer fish than cod.  Thank God it wasn't Tilapia though - gross.

The fries were a 2 out of 5 and the slaw was HORRIBLE.  What even is that stuff? I can't even explain it.  It was brown, but not like the cabbage was rotton, it has some brown stuff all over it but somehow it had no flavor at all.  How do you cover cabbage in brown stuff and have it be totally flavorless?  It tasted like water and the cabbage was slightly bitter (which means it was old).  Tower - you have got to step the slaw game up.  Just start over completely.  I would seriously rather have pre-packaged slaw than that mess you are serving.  

Speaking of pre-packaged: the tartar sauce is that horrible sweet stuff that comes in the bottle - like the Safeway Select one.  I understand that this is a burger joint, but fish and chips is the only thing on the menu aside from burgers and it's like FEATURED on their menu, so one would think it's a specialty. 

Two stars for the decent fish, the rest is in between blah and bad.
author: Emma H.

description:
Tower Burger has been in my families rotation since it was put in (Who remembers the video store?). We grab a to-go order every once in a while when cooking isn't in the cards. It's a solid choice and a decent burger in the area, so I would only give it 3 stars.

Food - 3/5
I normally get a regular hamburger with fries. It is a typical burger with red onions and pickles. The patty is usually cooked well, but can sometimes be a bit dry and lacks flavor. My remedy is ketchup and mustard. 

Service - 4/5
I haven't actually sat down to eat for a while, but I haven't really seen it super busy recently. Getting a table shouldn't be an issue too often. The owners seem really nice and the times I did sit in, service was fairly quick.

Ambience - 4/5
This is a great place for groups of all sizes, as it is large and usually quiet enough for conversation. It is clean and not a bad place to stop for a quick burger that isn't "fast food".
author: Ryan J.

description: Yelp hours are incorrect - says they are open til 9pm in Mondays, but I just came in and they said they were closing in 5 minutes. Maybe another review regarding incorrect hours will move the proprietors to get on Yelp's case about making sure the hours are correct!
author: Lora L.

description: It's a good restaurant. People is good, food is delicious. Is a good place to go in Miraloma
author: Nicol R.

description: I have been going to this place for several years now and have had a consistent experience every time: great burgers, quick friendly service and overall good dining experience. Everything on the menu I have tried has been very tasty: turkey burger Hawaiian style, Cobb salad, burgers, and fish and chips. If you are looking for a tasty burger for a good price..this is the spot to go. Plus, there is always good parking.
author: Brett H.

description:
Dear Tower Burger,
We love you. Especially your California Chicken Sandwich, your Chicken Cobb Salad (with ranch dressing), your large order of french fries, and your extremely large order of onion rings. We miss you now that we moved to the Marina district but we see you when we can. Please don't take our long gaps between visits as a sign that we love you less. Just know that we think of you often and come back as often as our car is willing to take the long journey South.
Best,
M & L
author: Michael B.

description:
Burgers = good. Juicy. Niman Ranch beef patty.  Always a fan of the California burger. Crisp lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, red onion, avocado, Jack cheese and sprouts. (They offer grilled chicken sandwiches, garden burgers, other sandwiches, salads and fish & chips.)

Fries = good. They also have sweet potato fries now. 

Service = friendly. (Order at the counter, pay, and then wait or seat yourself.)  

Prices = moderate. $23 for two burgers (one specialty and one cheeseburger), one order of fries and two sodas.

Clean burger joint!  Oh and they have milkshakes, too!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Their burgers aren't memorable.  What's frustrating is that sometimes when I go in, they say I can only get take-out, even if they're open for another 25 minutes.  That's plenty of time to eat a burger.  There's also nothing else in that neighborhood, so it's not easy to go elsewhere and it just makes for a disappointing evening.

Also, their Monday hours are incorrect here on Yelp as of Jan 10, 2017.  I told them many months ago that they could correct it, but nothing has been done.

Their overall attitude towards customers could be improved.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
There's not a lot to this review, but I think it's a fitting reflection of Tower Burger (in a good way).  While there are a lot of trendy and hyped up places in the city to try, it's nice coming to a place like this that is refreshingly quiet and relaxed.  It's fun to hit the town, but it's also just as fun to be lazy and grab a simple burger without a hassle!

In nearly every way, Tower Burger is the epitome of a "no fuss, no muss" kind of joint.  There's a wealth of seating, the staff is friendly, service is quick, and the menu is simple yet functional - a variety of burgers, salads, fish & chips, sides, and shakes (with Mitchell's ice cream!).  It's a perfect fit, and quite popular, with the neighborhood as well - a lot of families and regulars stop in to both dine in and grab some take out.

-- TOWER BURGER with Bacon, Grilled Onions, Sauteed Mushrooms, and Cheese...$7.99
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tower-burger-san-francisco#VFjwj84V5Y7NXcGATV5xZw)
I wouldn't rave about it like how others have, but it was a solid burger nonetheless.  The bun wasn't the best, but the patty had a nice char and was decently juicy.  It could have used a little more seasoning, but the mushrooms, bacon, and cheese helped.

-- CHILI CHEESE FRIES...$6.99
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tower-burger-san-francisco#PkGHWyGnR95N4BCOcJhN6g)
A bit of a miss, to be honest.  The fries themselves were more or less fine, and there was a decent amount of beans and meat, but the chili was really, really watery.  The taste was okay, but it was so thin that barely any of it stuck to the fries. 

THREE AND A HALF STARS overall, but I (generously) rounded up in spite of the chili cheese fries.  The regular fries and onion rings my friends ordered were just fine, so those would probably be the better route to go.  In any case, even though Tower Burger may not fare well when compared to gourmet spots in the city, they're as solid of a bet as you'll find among "neighborhood burger joints".  If nothing else, they're certainly the most convenient!
author: Mike L.

description: I just inhaled a cheeseburger here. It was a yummy, well cooked surprise. All the ingredients were of good quality, the joint is super clean and the service friendly & efficiant. Good neighborhood burger spot.
author: Sally S.

description: Very tasty and clean burger. Also put together very well and cooked to perfection. I got the California burger
author: Lito Z.

description:
Great burger from a great neighborhood. I came in one evening on a weekday and thought I was sinking my teeth into a beef burger, but realized it was a vegetarian one. It's that good!

The fries that come with are awesome, served warm and fast from their great staff. Definitely a place to come back to.
author: Ryan K.

description:
I 've been to Tower Burger for years and lately I just notice that the staff and the owner don't have any skill to greet their customers even though a nice "Hello " or " Good-day" in a nice way.
We are the customers and we come here to buy your moderate price food. 
In &Out Burger has a better courtesy than them.
So disappointed !!!!
author: Benny B.

description: This is my local go to place when I get a hankering for a burger.  Nice family run place where they welcome you like family and friends.  Burgers are cooked to order with good quality meat, veggies and cheese.  It's nice to see local sports teams, police officers and firemen.  Just like the old days so to speak.  Nice to see.  This is not a hipster joint and doesn't try to be, it's just a plain burger place, that's all.
author: Mike K.

description: Tasty burgers and friendly fast service especially since we came in late...almost closing and still took care of us.
author: Darin B.

description:
Tower Burger is a great little neighborhood burger joint. The service is always quick, they are friendly, and always professional. 

It's unique but it's great!
author: Corrie H.

description: The more I come here the less I like it. The first time I ate here was the best time. Service is always rushing instead of slowing down offering a little small talk and a smile. But typical Asian business, business is business no messing around, I get it. Being the only burger joint up here they can be a bit pricey if you're buying for a group. They can up-sell because they are the only ones. Burgers are better than any of the other sandwiches they have here. Chicken sandwich has been dry the last couple times I have come here.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
I stopped in at 8:10 (all of their advertising says they are open until 9 PM ) I asked for ham to be added to my turkey club and the girl just looked at me like she clearly didn't understand, and then looked up at the ceiling and said "we are closing, we only have orders to go. This has been an issue for tower burger in the past, they don't seem to understand the concept of a special order, (like adding ham to a club sandwich.) when she told me they were closing and only had orders to go - 45 minutes BEFORE their advertised closing - I walked out. I have never, in the last 3 or 4 years, been able to get exactly what I order when I do give them a chance. It's not that hard! I give them a try about every six months, and it has just degenerated time after time, and tonight was the last time. It's time I said something.
 The ownership changed probably 3 or 4 years ago, and the restaurant has never been the same. They don't get your order right, and they close earlier then advertised. From this point on I am going to Bulls Head in West Portal. Bulls Head has a better menu, better quality meat, and no problem with special orders (this is how you get and KEEP customers.) I am just done with the clowns at Tower burger. They clearly are trying to run a business they know NOTHING about. It's sad, because 3 or 4 years ago, before they changed ownership, they were really pretty good. I have given them enough chances, i'm just done. Do yourself a favor and go to any other burger restaurant than tower burger. There are plenty of other good places out there in the vicinity if you don't mind heading to West portal or to the Castro.
author: Michael M.

description:
The food here is below average for the area and average for a burger joint. There's just no reason to choose Tower Burger unless you couldn't find parking in West Portal or Glen Park; the parking is literally the best thing about this place. 

I've been coming here on and off since I was in high school, and not much has changed. It's the same plain interior, same standard menu. Kind of run down after so many years. The only changes have been the price hikes and more inconsistency. You can have a good meal here (and in general, it seems like the burger patties are of good quality), you just don't know when. The toppings are often cool or undercooked, and the shakes can be icy. The burger is always medium-well no matter how you order it. 

I just don't know why you'd pay almost $20 (with tip) for a so-so burger, fries and a soda when you can get better for the same price literally anywhere, or comparable offerings for less. Convenience? Without the parking lot this place would've been gone years ago, and that's sad.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Great place to eat awesome and clean stop by ordered a Buger and Garlic fries for my daughter. She loved it will be Back soon.
author: Darlene M.

description: Been eating here for a long time. The burgers are good, not great. Salads are fairly large, and the fries are crispy. Place your order at the counter, pick a seat, and your food will be brought to you. Nothing fancy. Good place for a relaxed family dinner and parking is always easy.
author: Debra K.

description:
Simple burger joint. Clean, quick, and convenient (because, let's face it- there is only this, a taqueria, or the awful Mollie Stones within like a mile of here). 

Aside from burgers, you can also order a sandwich, fish&chips, or salad. 

I have not tried the sandwiches, but would not recommend the fish&chips b/c the fish portions are too small and the dish is super greasy. 

Out of the burgers I've tried, I prefer the California burger. The onion rings are also the way to go here.
author: Nina M.

description: Love this place!!! The food is awesome, they also serve my favorite sweet potato fries. There's a pokestop nearby, good for the Pokemon go addicts :D
author: Yvonne W.

description:
Decent food at reasonable prices can be found at this neighborhood spot.  My in laws live nearby so it's a great choice if you don't want to go too far.  The better spot will be Bull's head in West Portal but it's further away.

Service is very friendly and the food came out quickly and per our order.  It's not too noisy inside which is always good for families.  

Sometimes, simple but well prepared foods are the best!
author: Gene D.

description:
Best hawaiian burger!!!!
My boyfriend and I always go and order a burger and a chicken salad and share. So full filling, yummy, and fresh.
I love eating at tower burger.
author: Yunmi J.

description: The sofa against the wall is dirty, the walls are dirty, and it looks like people have been attacking my plate for years with a spear. Their food is really basic. I've had food for the same price for much better quality. It sad to see this place has so much room for potential but has really let their business go downhill. Tower burger, I hope you get your stuff together and start caring about your business.
author: Chris C.

description: Most times I come in because it's convenient in my neighborhood and I do work hard to support local businesses but there is usually some problem with the order. The service is not always good to worst and the burgers are nothing to brag about. I now work hard not to patronize.
author: Jim S.

description:
Have came here a few times because of mutual friends who like the burgers. The burgers are okay, not spectacular.. Especially for their prices. Burger doesnt come with fries!?! So i would be paying roughly $14-15 for both total. Kinda pricey for a mediocre burger

Oh and they dont have the greatest customer service..
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for a long long time.  Today I was craving a good burger and some fries.  After class today a friend suggested Tower Burger.  Said they serve basic burgers with Niman Ranch ground beef patties.   

You walk in and order off a laminated menu at the counter.  Better read quickly as the order taker/cashier is waiting to take your order.  Pay, take your number, and sit down.

I got a jack cheeseburger with all the dressing - lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and Bermuda sliced onion, and a side of fries, and a fountain soda.  Hubby got the bacon cheddar cheeseburger.  Our charbroiled burgers were cooked to order.  The fries were piping hot.  Burgers were juicy.  All for about $20.

I don't understand the negative reviews.  Service was quick.  Food was very good.  Easy parking.
author: Shirley N.

description: The burgers are fairly tasty, but if you're going to refuse to take orders 20 minutes before closing, I'm not sure what the point of staying "open" is.
author: Andrew F.

description: I've been coming here for years.  The family that owns the place are the nicest you can ever meet.  They ALWAYS  make sure that your order is right and the cook, Angel,  gets your order out really fast.  They always use the best meat. I've NEVER had a bad meal. I wish more people knew about this little jem.  If you come,  you won't be disappointed.
author: Susan A.

description:
It's funny how, growing up, a burger was a burger.  Then, a burger became a Burger... and then a BURGER!  For me, there is now a three-tier system in discussing burgers.  
First, we have the 'let's have a simple one' burger which, to some, may include the most popular McD's, BK, Wendy's, Carl's Jr. and... yes, In 'N Out.
Next, we have the 'I like a lot of toppings and meaty tasting' burger like Bistro or Custom Burger and, in the old days, Barney's.
Last, we have the 'wagyu lovin', does it have truffles or foie?, where's dat beef from' burger.  See Umami, Marlowe, and Burger Bar.

Yes, this is a neighborhood place.
Yes, this is a NON-chain business.
Yes, there is little if any wait here.
Yes, it is a less than a five minute drive from home.

Coming here several times as a "let's get a quick bite" stop, I usually order a burger with their onion rings.  They offer a variety of cheeses and topping, including my favorite mushrooms (shrrroooooms!).  I've also had their chili cheese fries which are very filling and best shared.  The vibe definitely fits the family oriented neighborhoods as you'll often find families with young children (after school sports activities) dining here.  Don't expect a foodie experience here... just a solid local meal.
author: Mike C.

description:
Good customer service: fast and friendly. We pop in and out for to go orders. 

I really like the veggie burger menu, there are many different choices of flavors. I tend to stick with the California burger as I love avocado. 

My husband likes the hamburger, says the patties are fresh. 

Overall, this is a great low key spot with quick service.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Sooo the interior was definitely a budget job, they had a few jerseys staple gunned on the wall, 2-3 potted plants,  throw in a dozen cheap tables, and DONE!!! I was a bit confused when I walked. There was a service counter so we walked up to it and the waitress/host- perhaps she would be a hoistress, waistress, well what ever her roll was she chucked a few laminated menus at us and we ordered. 
  Well the burger was decent, its not the best I've had and its not the worst. The fries were a it underdone, but I think that I just got them on a bad day. The price wasn't to bad, and they are close to my house so If I am craving another burger, and feeling reeeeeeeaaly lazy I probably will visit them again. My brother did get the fish and chips and he was impressed so next time perhaps I will try those.
author: Atom H.

description:
Not much by way of good eats in this neck of the woods, Round Table Pizza & Tower Burger dominate the eats scene. This phenon confirms that there is a place for the stark, sterile and ho-hum eatery. Burger was plain, even with a description of "Mushroom burger * Smoothered in mushroom's", yes a few landed on the patty but not enough to tickle the taste buds. Environ. is plain, with about as much charm.

Tower is producer of a 'good' burger, if compared to the giant chain joints, not so good compared to the joints like Barneys Burgers which is a 5 minute drive down the hill to Noe Valley. Goodness is relative, part of the general theory of relativity...of Burger Goodness.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/barneys-gourmet-hamburger-san-francisco-2

Interestingly both Barneys Burger and Tower Burger tout using the premium beef from Niman Ranch. Its a little like thinking a Chevy will compete with a Ferrari, cos'  they both are rolling on Pirrelli's. Like a burger, a car can be judged by the stuff that goes on top that makes it special, not what it is riding on.

Yep, this burger joint is for the folks who utter things like: "My car gets me from point A to point B", this joint will get a burger seeker from point A to point B. Its an amazing thing to see the 4 & 5 star reviews, for this joint... I guess it helps when a joint like this is on the "friends & family plan"....
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Finally made it out here because we have been craving burgers. We ordered a turkey burger with cheese and mushrooms, and a chicken cheese sandwich/burger. Yeah I know we didnt get actual burgers, but we still want to be health conscious. I cant attest to the niman ranch meet, but the chicken burger tasted great. just enough meat, and with everything on it, the vegis were very fresh, crunchy, and tasty. 

The Turkey Burger tasted good but the shape seemed too perfect, as maybe it was frozen packaged????... At Least it tasted good. 

The place was super fast with service, friendly and clean. You have to add fries, and we shared from one small order which we thought was plenty, washed down with water. It was about 10$/person, and i am completely full, satisfied though i still think each burger should come with fries when priced over 8$, and a self serve drink menu. 

Definitely coming back to try a real burger next time i have a cheat day.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Place was clean. Very efficient! Food came out in less than 10 minutes. I gave a four because fries wasn't cooked all the way. Who doesn't like golden crispy fries to go with a burger??
author: Rho G.

description:
the burgers were good, i think what did it was the niman ranch beef, every other ingredient was just your typical burger joint stuff

the onion rings, paid 4 dollars for a small portion...
author: Long C.

description: Not impressed I can make a better burger then this shit. I ordered a tower burger with a extra patty.  So pretty much a double cheese burger. Got a fountain drink plus fries. Charged me $19 bucks and some change. Expensive ass charbroiled frozen patties no flavor ass burger. They add water to their katchup bottles. Katchup was a lil extra watery. Left feeling unsatisfied and frustrated because i paid for shitty food. Never again
author: Tha U.

description:
It pains me to downgrade Tower Burger as the food is still a 3-4 level.  But after last night's experience, I doubt I'll ever eat there again.  

Tower Burger has been a regular place to get good, simple grub.  Last night, I and some friends arrived at 8:40 pm.  The woman asked us if we wanted take out or were going to sit down.  I said we'd like to sit down.  She said "We close at 9."  Usually that means the kitchen closes and you can't order food.  

I asked if we sat down, did she mean we had to leave at 9 pm?  "Yes."  Not believing what I heard, I asked again.  If we order food and sit down, we have to leave at 9 pm?  "Yes, do you still want to order?"  "No, not with that attitude." I replied.

I strongly recommend they put up a sign at 8:30 pm which says "Take out orders only" or post a sign that says that.  I've NEVER been to a restaurant that tells you have to leave when they close.  Granted, most diners don't linger that long, or asking them to leave 30 minutes after closing is OK,  but telling someone they have to leave when you close?  

My first review was in 2008 and I've been eating at Tower Burger ever since. I'm sorry to have to look for another burger place that's nearby, but that attitude kills any appetite I have for their food.
author: Scott S.

description:
I'm a fan of Tower Burger - pretty quick service and delicious burgers as well

Ordered a California Burger to-go which had excellent lettuce (nice and crispy) as well as fresh avocado,which I appreciated. Was a bit sad that it didn't come with the fries, but the burger was worth the $7-8 itself.

Also can't go wrong with a milkshake! This was a bit small for the price, but it was so tasty on a warm weekend. Just the right texture and taste of strawberry - highly recommended
author: Brandon Y.

description: Good burgers and fries, but terrible customer service. My friend and I clearly ordered chicken strips, but they gave us fish and chips. We asked if we could get what we ordered, but the man just said "we already made that" and kind of dismissed us.
author: Kees H.

description:
Ordered the mushroom burger with fries.  Burger is very juicy and tasty, fries are crisp, really nothing to complain about when it comes to the food.  I had to knock off a start just because of the restaurant itself.  When I walked in, I just wasnt feeling it.  It almost felt like a cafeteria, and when I eat a burger, I like to enjoy the experience, if you know what I mean.  Take In-N-Out, you get the whole diner vibe and the loud kitchen and it feels like burger time there.  Here at Tower, meh, not so much.  You might as well take your burger home and enjoy it at home, if you live across the street.

If you just need the burger without the frills, then this is your place.
author: Kris P.

description:
Not sure what people are complaining about- I love this place. The burgers AND salads are consistently delicious. And for the price they charge, their quality is fresh, tasty, and its a much bigger portion than most burger joints. Most places would charge alot more for the quality and quantity.

I highly recommend this place and can't wait to eat there again!! (Try the mushroom burger its my fave!)
author: jenni k.

description:
Tower Burger is a reason why San Francisco is amazing - MOM and POP restaurants that are original and amazing! Came off my flight and went straight here with a friend for a burger and was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED. I was expecting an average burger, something to quell the beast in my belly, but the "Tower Burger" was perfectly cooked, moist, delicious and flavorful! The patty was cooked perfectly medium rare to my liking as well. The cheese melted around the patty and in my mouth! 

My friend ordered the 4 prawns + 2 fish and chips - OMG, even better than the burger were the prawns, sinfully crunchy and buttery! So good, the fish was amazing and the fries were addicting. I didn't get a chance to try the coleslaw that came with this meal, but then again, I didn't want to waste my stomach volume w/ vegetables (even vegetables swimming in mayo). 

The restaurant is very low key, you order at the counter and they bring it out to your table - come eat, have a good burger and be on your merry way. The lady taking our order was a little rushed but I expect that type of service in these kinds of places - its about the food not the experience here!
author: Christina N.

description: Three star. Not great. Solid.  I asked for the server's recommendation... he said the Tower Burger.  I tried it. Pretty tasty. Onion rings were a little bit greasy.  My friends didn't enjoy theirs as much. The turkey burger was a little dull and the chicken strips were kind of under-seasoned.
author: Allyn V.

description:
A solid burger place with crispy fries, juicy burgers and tasty milkshakes. It's a very casual atmosphere and decor, and I've never had trouble finding a place to sit because it's so big. I also love that this is a place where you walk in, order at the counter, and they'll bring your food over to you. I also saw people call in orders to go, which is great and I'll keep in mind for future use.

There's also bottled beer in the fridge (no tap), along with a variety of sodas (even Jarritos.)

As we walked in, the woman was ready to take our order right away but I'd never been there. I would recommend that they start by handing you a menu and saying "let me know when you're ready to order." Or maybe place the menus on a stand by the door? I ended up speed reading through the menu to make a selection as the woman stood there staring at me, which made me feel awkward. I'd also love it if they had a tv in there for sports games.
author: Krista J.

description: Ate here this past Saturday and I swear the burgers shrunk by 20%.    Still very juicy but way smaller.   Hmmm.......
author: n y.

description:
I used to live half a block from this place, and they used to have the best onion rings. Now that I moved to a different district, I only get here once or twice a year. Well I guess it has been about two years since I got their onion rings. And since then they seem to have switched from delicious homemade onion rings YUM to pre-made frozen boxed onion rings BOO. 

This is a tragedy on par with Darfur.

Their grilled cheese sandwiches are still excellent, though.
author: Dorkus A.

description:
My friend and I had never eaten here before but passed by many times, so today was the day.  As we entered, the lady at the counter immediately asked what we wanted.  I didn't even have time to figure out where the menu was.

I had the BBQ burger with cheese and fries.  I wanted it cooked well done, but there was still some pale pink in the center when I took a bite.  The fries were hot and fresh.  All the food was good, but not outstanding.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
Closer to 3.5 out of 5.  Very solid burger joint that is close to great... just missing a little "wow" factor.  

I have been a casual dinner at Tower Burger since they opened.  The burgers here are pretty darn good.  Their patties are all made from Niman ranch beef and their milkshakes are made from Mitchell's Ice Cream.... needless to say their ingredients are all top notch.

FOOD

Tower Burger - 3.5 out of 5 - Comes with grilled onion, bacon, mushroom and cheese.  Very good burger.  The bacon, of course, is good and adds a nice bacon kick, grilled onion and mushrooms add a nice earthiness.

Western Burger - 3.5 out of 5 - Home made BBQ sauce and aged chedder.  The BBQ is very good with a nice tang to it.  The cheddar is good balances well.

Onion rings - 4 out of 5 - Very well done.  They have a nice crunch to them but aren't crunchy... a sign they are made fresh.  Can't go wrong here

AMBIENCE

Tower Burger is kind of an in between burger place.  It isn't a dive and it is far from fancy.  The layout is pretty generic and almost feels like a chain restaurant... not a lot of personality.  It is however very clean and a nice place to eat

OVERALL

I've been here many times over the years and have always enjoyed my meals, but that is mostly because it is so close to where I (now used to) live.  While the place is solid... it is missing that "special something" to really put it in my upper tier of burger places.  Great place to eat if your in the area, but if you are looking for something special there are better places to go.
author: Rob P.

description: Neighborhoody hamburger joint its ok...Asian run they Chinese(?) kinda curt and all about the $ profits way I see it...never any bargains here for below standard grub, cafe could use some updating and improved better foods! The owner WHY can't she ever have weekly specials???
author: Ron M.

description:
this is a business based on Cost-cutting, cost-cutting, cost-cutting.   Cheap ingredients, cheap decor, and outrageous prices.  Double burger, small cup of chili, shake and sweet potato fries... $27!  Almost disgusting chili, flavorless almost no meat in it.  Burger was average at best with the cheapest vegetables you could find anywhere.  The bun was cheap and a turn off; like what you'd find at Safeway A dollar for half a dozen. 
  Sweet potato fries were hot and delicious; Mitchell's ice cream vanilla shake was boring.  The service was good and very fast.  I won't go back.
author: W. H.

description:
Called in an order for pick up around 8:30. Got a Tower Burger and onion rings.
They said get here in 5 minutes-we close at 9. Got there in ten, and the chairs were all up, and they seemed really anxious to go home. My order was all ready to go. 

The burger was cooked exactly the way I wanted it, and the onion rings were really good. I would go back, but maybe try to go a little earlier.
author: El B.

description:
I'm a real fan of hamburgers and Tower Burger didn't disappoint, the burger I had was cooked to perfection and reasonably priced. I didn't order fries but in hindsight wished I had.

The service was quick and the restaurant clean, definitely a place I would like to go back to.
author: Matt B.

description:
One of the best burgers in SF!
Kevin is the owner and he is awesome.
There are lots of different choices of burgers that are fresh and juicy.
My favorite is the California burger that has avocado and sprouts included. 
I would definitely recommend this place especially if you are near twin peaks.
author: Woo L.

description:
Why I did not get a burger in a restaurant that says "burger" in its name is beyond me. The picture of a club sandwich on Yelp swayed my better judgement.  

The sandwich to look nice. However, they use processed turkey and too much dark leafy green lettuce.  The lettuce did not add to the sandwich.  It was more like a filler with no taste or crunch.  Don't get it.

The fries are not as good as other Yelp reviews stated. They were kind of soggy.  

My friend said her burger was pretty good.  If, we go again I'll try the burger and onion rings.

The staff was nice and efficient.  The place was full at around 1 o'clock on a Friday. Lots of takeout during the time we were there.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Used to go here at least once every other week. But after tonight, I'll be telling all my family and friends not to. 

They close at 9pm and I walked in at 830pm. I was welcomed with a "We close at 9" yelled from the kitchen by the owner. There were still 30 minutes until they closed so we asked if I can still order. I was met with an eye roll and a turned shoulder as if I just committed a sin. 

Well, they took our order and I sat down to eat. Now I've been to restaurants that stop accepting customers at closing time, however, still serve the paying customers that were already dining in their restaurant. 

Not this place. This place made it obvious it wanted they're paying customers out. My food was rushed out and I wasn't offered things like condiments or checked on how I was doing. 

The owner walked around the restaurant acting upset like she was gonna be late for a date or something. The final straw was at 910pm, just 10 minutes after closing, she turned the restaurant lights off while paying, eating customers were still inside. 

I don't know where she learned customer service skills or how to treat paying customers, but that was completely unacceptable. There were at least two other people still eating their meal when she turned the lights off to kick us out. 

Personally, I judge restaurants 50/50 by quality of food and service. The service at this place was just appalling. 

I would not recommend this place for people that appreciate good food service and common decency and courtesy.
author: Darwin N.

description:
Pros:Patty melt was awesome! 
I love their onion rings
Clean interior with friendly staff!
They take orders through the phone so it's ideal for anything who's willing to take out.

Cons: price? A little bit or maybe it's because I just order a lot.
author: Daniel H.

description: Super good burgers, really enjoy the western burger and the vegi burgers. The chocolate shakes are really good and the food is fast! The fries are expensive though and don't come with the burgers, realistically you are looking at spending about $15 for a burger + fries and tax. Next time I will split fries with the girlfriend. All in all, yummy spot.
author: Ryan G.

description: Happened to stumble upon this place while in town.  I was hungry as hell so went in and gave it a try.  I made a good choice because this place serves up a delicious cheeseburger.  I'll tell you what, you bite the fries and they bite you back.... Trust me, You won't be disappointed.
author: Brandon B.

description: Fun place.  Solid burgers.  The plates of fries are huge!!!  The kids love the place and they are so kid friendly.
author: Steve A.

description: Hands down! !  the best burger in town... & don't forget their Strawberry Shake the beast!!
author: REd N.

description:
Onion rings. 'Nuff said. I'm not even a huge onion ring fan, but man Tower's onion rings had me mentally editing my favorite foods list.

In addition to ordering a plate of onion rings, my roomie for the mushroom burger (yuck! I hate mushrooms with a passion) and I got the California burger without sprouts (yum! I love me some avocados!). I asked for my burger to be cooked medium-well, but was disappointed to see it cooked well-done. However, I wasn't willing to make it an issue. Compared to other burgers I have had (Beep's, Umami's), this burger ranked pretty average.

Though the service was great and the onion rings were DELISH, I would not come back. I think I overpaid for a mediocre burger.
author: Surge C.

description: Easy to order. Very friendly. Bench seats need new covers. Bathrooms very clean. Everything is very orderly and organized. Fish is good. Fries need salt. Need a larger serving of Cole slaw. Food is clean and simple. That's a good thing. If your hungry and you want to get in and out this place will meet your needs. Ample parking out front. AND IM FULL.
author: Peter c.

description: I'm personally a HUGE FAN of ROAM ARTISAN BURGERS and this place totally sucks compared to Roam. Very limited healthy options for those who want the burger but not the "NIMAN Ranch" GMO fed cattle.... Ugh. And just crappy hamburger buns.... The cheap $0.99 type. This place is honestly one step ahead of McDonald's... I even prefer In&Out burger over this place.
author: Deb D.

description: I've been pretty happy with this place. I've been going low-carb so I get a tuna salad and have them add a burger patty to it. The tuna salad portion is generous, the greens are always fresh, and the burger patty is tasty. Service can be perfunctory, but whatever. And there's lots of parking room (metered) out front.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Im always in search of a good burger. One of the burgers in particular that I go hunting for, is The Patty Melt. This burger is like BigFoot to me, you see it at a burger place once, when you go, then you look for it at another burger joint and it's missing! Or the bread is wrong! Or the bread is not grilled or toasted! Or the burger patty is too tough! Or they put sauce in it! Ughhh!! I'm going crazy!
Then There was a sighting of the legendary BigFoot Patty Melt. It was seen  resting on the menu of Tower burger! They have the legendary Patty Melt! They use Rye bread! Check! They butter and grill the bread! Check! They use Neiman Ranch beef! Check! They have Caramelized onions! Check! I Have found my BigFoot! It's one of the better patty melts I have had.
It's really juicy. The quality is tasted in every bite. I'm so glad my search has come to an end.
author: Roger P.

description:
High quality food for a reasonable price!!!
Had a Burger first time, and had a fish and chips for second time visit.
Didn't expect such food for it is not a fancy restaurant.  Surprisingly taste was awesome as well as service.  Very quick and kind!!!
Highly recommend this place if you want a burger before or after visiting twin peaks!!!
author: Richard P.

description:
One guy called this place a staple and I have to agree. It's up the hill from my house in GP so I go here a lot. Numbero Uno is plenty of parking - Yeee Hawww!!

The burgers are good, as well as, the fries and onion rings. one thing you have to watch out for is if it comes out too soon - no one likes to wait but I want the burger to be newly cooked and sometimes it comes out in 5 minutes - when they didn't even have time to cook it. It's cold or maybe just cooler than hot, but it doesn't have that good flavor - as long as that's in the clear - it's a decent burger, and it doesn't cost $15 bucks like at Barneys on 24th!
author: Rew C.

description:
I just wish they were more generous with the onion rings that I had ordered.  They charged me an extra $3.50 for a side of onion rings to go with my burger, and I got a total of 6 onion rings!  

Don't get me wrong these rings were good with a nice, creamy ring of hot onion surrounded by a golden, crispy battered shell but considering the quantity/price - totally not worth it!

I had the Tower Burger with crispy bacon, mushrooms, grilled onions and cheese (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zriqhz9jWIY0Y-PXBnLDCw?select=IwWOuCbco5F4LAPF0RUi-A).  The burger was cooked a perfect medium well with just the right amount of pink and juices flowing.  Very beefy flavor although there was just a slight charred taste to the meat.

You order at the counter and you're given a table number.  Your food is brought to you lightning fast.  I think my wait was less than five minutes and my food was ready to go.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
"O we close!"

That at 8:50pm on a Saturday night? After which they served someone who entered the establishment AFTER I did?

Their food ain't that great, and the work ethic/attitude SUCKS. I live in their neighborhood, and have been to this place many times before. But after the treatment I received tonight, NEVER again.
author: Edna T.

description: Love the basic burger with onion rings.  I'm not a huge fan of their french fries but I always steal some anyway.  Patty melt is the best anywhere.  Rye bread - buttered and grilled.  We've been going here for years and still enjoy it!
author: Carrie N.

description: 3  simple because this is a burger spot with its own unique take on a burger.  I ordered my Paris Burger and it was good. Nothing too special about it but I enjoyed it. It's a bit pricey for my taste though.  If in the area and I'm having the urge for burgers I'll go again but I'll look first for other spots I have yet to tryout.
author: Joshua P.

description:
My favorite in tower burger is fish and chips. It's best found so far. I tried it different places.not much tasty like tower burger.  more crispy and tasty. good price too. My hubby always order bacon cheese burger. I'll try bacon cheese burger in next time.
 They are quick and provide a good food in this town.
author: Sookjung H.

description:
I'll gladly pay you Tuesday for a hamburger today. 

I'm always in search of a good burger, but it seems like you could start a riot when you claim this place or that place has the 'best' burger. Tower Burger came up on one of those lists, and since I was close by, I thought I'd check it out. Walked in on a Sunday night, the cashier was very friendly. I ordered a mushroom burger with a side of onion rings and also decided to take the Mitchell's chocolate shake for a spin. 

Verdict: Not bad. Meat is advertised as Niman Ranch. People in SF seem to be obsessed with that Niman Ranch beef. Anywho, the burger was nice an juicy. It was topped off with grilled mushrooms, cheddar cheese, red onions, pickle slices, tomato, green lettuce, and mayo on a sesame seed bun. Overall a fairly average burger. Onion rings are the frozen kind, but I was hungry and they were good. Mitchell's shake was creamy, although tasted small ice crystals in it, possibly a sign that the ice cream had accumulated some frost. But I'll note that they opted to keep the shake in the freezer while the food was prepared so it wouldn't melt. That's some good thinkin' right there. Service was fast, too, although they forgot the grilled onions on one of our burgers. 

The place is pretty spacious, and actually nicely decorated. Plenty of street/metered parking right in front. I think Yelp says that it's cash only, but I saw that they take Visa and MC. 

They're open daily from 10am-9pm. Go and support your local family businesses!
author: Saunders C.

description:
I've been meaning to stop by here forever, so while I was returning from a shopping venture, I stopped in on my way home. This place seems very popular, but I'm not sure why. First of all for a bacon cheeseburger, fries and a Coke the charge came to $12 and change. In this town that is not really that expensive, but this burger was not worth it, Actual the meat patty itself was tasty, I understand it's Niman Beef. But the bun was no better than something you find on sale at Safeway. The lettuce and tomatoes did not seem that fresh. And overall I could've made this at home myself and it would have been better. 
The french fries were little greasy, but they were long and tasty. Just nothing to write home about. 
There are a lot of good places to get hamburgers in SF so I don't think I'll be coming back here. However I don't want to give the impression that this was a horrible dining experience, I didn't feel ripped off, I didn't think the food was bad, it just wasn't very satisfying.
author: Gary B.

description:
After a day of helping my friend set up and break down her wedding stuff at Stern Grove, I decided to grab some food at Tower Burger.  I went around 3pm and they were already out of the Portabello Mushroom which was my first choice.  I ended up getting the brie cheese and sauteed mushrooms hambuger.  I asked for medium on my burger but it was more on the medium well side.  Well, no matter though, as it was juicy and flavorful.  Price wise, it is almost priced right at $7 to $8 per burger.  Fries are separate and so are drinks.

If I do come back, I hope to get the portabella or a chicken sandwich just as a change of pace.
author: Ben H L.

description: I was expecting much more after I saw all the reviews... Or I am really picky and I didn't notice that.. I asked for a tower burger what should be their best burger... The meat was ok but no sauce in there just a wishy washy. I really hate to put mustard or pepper on burger but I had too this time. The fries were not that good, I think I should asked for the famous onion rings but the fires was really common and oily... The ambient is good but the food is not that much... Only a really the layer of chews came with my burger instead of a melting cheese that you expect of a cheeseburger... Even McDonald's has thicker layers of cheese.. But since I was starving I ate it all.. But I had the feeling that I paid too much for a common burger
author: Breno R.

description:
First time here and I thought it was pretty good. Beef comes from Niman Ranch. Due to the high ceilings in this place, the noise level can get pretty loud quick. I'm glad I came here right before closing with my friend. 

Food:

- Paris Burger (1 beef patty, a thick slice of brie cheese, sauteed mushrooms and condiments) 

- Peach Tea

Surprisingly, I cleaned the plate of my burger, fries AND ketchup. I must have been really hungry, cuz I'm satisfied now. I thought this place was better than Five Guy's fall apart burger.
author: Jason C. J.

description: My son has grown up here, and it is as great as it was day one.  The best burgers in town by far.  I get their great philly cheese steak.  You cannot beat the service either.  Family friendly and a joy of a place to sit down and have some great fries and a milkshake.  A real milkshake.
author: Gregory P.

description:
I'm not a fan of hamburgers in general but hubby needed "comfort" food he told me which translates to mean he wants a hamburger. This place is a nice, family owned small business with nice owners.  Very casual and I'll bet quite popular with the SOTA high school and nearby elementary school kids during the school year. 

The mushroom burger I had was OK.  Hubby says his hamburger was "good".  The Neiman Ranch beef patty tasted like any other decent beef patty I've had.  "Everything on it" came with a tomato slice, lettuce, and pickle slices. Hubby's meal came with bean chili (I didn't like it) and onion rings.  I usually love onion rings, but not these.  
It's not any better than a burger you can grill yourself on the 4th of July.  At least it's real food and not processed.
author: Ry T.

description:
Clean establishment, fast service, good food and decent portions. 

California Chicken Sandwich $7.89 - grilled chicken breast, jack cheese, pickles, red onions, sprouts, avocado, lettuce, and tomatoes on a French roll + $1.99 for onion rings. Chicken breast wasn't as dry as all grilled chicken breasts are.  Had a refreshing taste of sprouts, onions, and pickles.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zriqhz9jWIY0Y-PXBnLDCw?select=thz_LLrLexsccuzE0MMcoQ

Club House Sandwich $7.49 - turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on sliced wheat toast. Tasty triple decker but could've used a little more bacon.  The bacon was a little lost under the generous amount of fresh crisp leafy lettuce. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zriqhz9jWIY0Y-PXBnLDCw?select=cA0ADiAgxRXIt-63RkR57w 

Will return when I'm in the mood for burgers or sandwiches.
author: Hannah C.

description: I go to Tower burger every time I feel like eating burger or some kind of American traditional food. I have been eating there for almost a year and since I found that place, I don't want to go to any other Burger places anymore. I've tried almost all of the main dishes there so far, including Burgers, salads, sandwiches and other side orders. Since the first time I tried Tower Burger, I've never been disappointed about anything there. The foods are always great and there are many choices. The burgers are tasty and organic while the salads are healthy and delicious. You can also customize your burgers like adding some stuff that you love. My favorite flavor is California burger, which has avocado with bean sprouts and I enjoy adding mushroom to it. The meat can be cooked as your demand but let's try it medium rare so that you can still feel the sweet juice melt inside and the smoky flavor outside. In addition, the service is amazing, friendly and fast. All you have to do is queuing to take order and then have a sit. Even though there're peak hours or weekends, you'll never have to wait too long. The chef is professional and the cooking area is open-up so that you can see the food is made carefully and sanitarily in front of you. Moreover, the price is quite suitable compared to other customized Burger places, which is about $25 in total for two burgers, fried and two drinks. Consequently, Tower Burger is such a lovely tasty affordable place for everyone to gather with friends or family!
author: Dieu Nga T.

description: I love this place. Yes they close when they say they do. Get over it. Or read the signs and respect their hours perhaps. But the burgers are awesome, you get your food fast and the prices are reasonable. I've never had a bad meal there. And they took a to-go order at 8:58 which I thought was super cool. One of the top 5 burgers I've had in the city. To those that claim a "bad burger," go back! Every establishment has an off moment and to be honest, they have never disappointed me.
author: Miriam L.

description: Very disappointed service frankly, we lived closed by and drove just for tower burgers and we decided never come back again !I ordered a cheese burger,my boyfriend ordered tower burger and that lady with glasses served us 2 fries and beans instead, I mean TWO,not one,and she seems very upset with something that day,anyway we even got our water by ourself cuz no one was there to serve,eventually we left without finished those fries cuz those r too big portioned,not impressed AT ALL! I will tell everyone I know about bad service in tower burger
author: Nicole X.

description: I just have to say. You will not get this quality burger with this price. BJ's burgers are good, but their Hawaiian burger is much better and cheaper. Salads are very fresh. It was something i didnt expect to be good but it was amazing.  Also i have to talk about the onion ring. You must get onion rings with burger. Overall i had real good meal at tower burger. You gonna love this!!
author: Phillip N.

description: I've been eating Tower Burger's fries and burgers for about 3 years and I love it! The burgers taste nice and juicy, the fries always come out piping hot, what's there to not like? While reading some of the reviews on how the attitude of the employees suck or how the employees are rushing to go home, I have to say I don't blame them. As a student in the highschool 2 blocks down from Tower Burger I know that there are always students rushing in and making a mess of the place or rushing the cooks so they can get back to class on time (hence the fast cooking part of most reviews). The employees would be tired after serving a bunch of highschool students everyday! Who wouldn't be?! Even though the attitude may throw you off, their burgers will make up for it.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
The new internship is up in Twin Peaks, and driving to lunch isn't much of an option, so I need to start checking out some of the joints within walking distance of my workplace.  Tower Burger was first up.

Since it was my first day on the job I didn't really want a huge meal complete with a massive load of fries, so I just got myself a bbq cheddar veggie burger and a diet coke.  I will say however that the fries looked pretty amazing!  I will have to grab some after work sometime.

On to the burgers.  Since I only eat halal meat, I kept away from the beef, as incredibly tempting as it was.  This place has a relatively large selection of veggie burgers, and the bbq cheddar one seemed to call my name, and it definitely hit the spot.  The veggie burger patty was cooked just right, and the huge helping of bbq sauce with a melted slice of cheddar was the perfect accompaniment.  On top of that was a huge piece of fresh cut leaf lettuce, onions, tomato, and pickles.  Add in unlimited refills on the diet coke, and I was a happy happy camper!

Only down side was that a veggie burger and a diet coke ran me something like 9 dollars... yikes!!  The fish and chips also looked mighty tasty and are on the short list for next time I swing by.  This place gets pretty busy with the local school kid crowd around lunch time so be aware of that.  Super nice people behind the counter and a really clean seating area!
author: Brice H.

description:
Tower Burger is not mind-blowing or fancy, just solid and chill. I got the California burger with avocado, sprouts, and jack cheese, and some fries. Service was good and the food came out quickly, which is always nice. Their shakes are made with MItchell's ice cream, which I didn't try but imagine is great. 

It's no Pearl's, but if you live nearby and want a burger, I'd recommend it.
author: Joseph N.

description: Great burgers at expensive prices. I had a hard time getting over paying so much at a mom and pop diner. The milk shakes are mitchells ice cream so that was something a San Franciscan can appreciate. Service was also of great quality.
author: Ryan M.

description: Always solid. California Burger is great. They are fast, clean and have never disappointed.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I remember coming here a few years ago and not being impressed.  Came here for lunch a week ago with co-workers and I was pleasantly surprised.  Ordered a Mushroom and Cheese Burger which was well cooked and tasty.

I did not like their refilled glass ketchup bottles with fading paper logos.  Please replace the bottles frequently or use another container that is washable!
author: Thomas L.

description: Although I've been a long time customer (occasionally dropping in for the past 3 years) I can't disregard the terrible service they offer. Their burgers are fresh, but I've had multiple altercations with the cashiers (I presume they're the owners as well) that truly discourage me from supporting this business any further.
author: Nathaniel N.

description:
Went back after quite a few months. They now feature Niman Ranch organic ground beef in all their burgers. Love that.

Their burgers are so tasty. I reckon they are the best in the city, and they still have a huge number of veggie options (half the menu).

Their fries are tasty, their onion rings are tasty. 

I want to venture to try their fish and chips because it looks so good, but I always end up with a scrumptious burger.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Tower Burger is entrenched in the no-man's land of fast food burgers at gourmet prices.

The Paris Burger's Niman Ranch origin provides comfort when ordering medium rare, but may not even win a head-to-head taste match up with a Carl's Jr. Portobello burger (and would definitely lose a size contest).  Although the meat is juicy and bun fresh, the lack of sufficient seasoning is evident from start to finish.  Also, the brie's subtlety is incapable of impacting the Paris Burger's performance.

The onion rings are wonderfully crispy, heartily battered, and somehow capable of repelling excess grease that is characteristic of most rings.  However, once again, the portions are scant.  

Will not propose to revisit but willing to try again.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I've eaten here a couple times. Food is quite good.

I was in a hurry to grab a burger on my way to work the other day and they got it ready within five minutes. Sweet! I've eaten here several times and the food is always tasty and the service is fast.
author: Todd H.

description:
Tower Burger makes good burgers and great fries, among other things, in a small strip mall. That's really all you need to know.

Tower has been around for about 10 years for a reason: they take the food business seriously. You should go because they offer brown mustard, vinegar and hot sauce in addiiton to the standard four condiments. You should go because the restaurant is very clean. You should go because the food is prepared quickly and consistently. 

You shouldn't if you're heavily interested in the decor; it's inoffensive but unremarkable. Mixed in with pictures of landscapes and animals are large prints based on food still-lifes. Add in Montana and Young jerseys and you have the visual. (Now would someone tell all the bandwagon Niners fans who abandoned the team 10 years ago to buy Patrick Willis jerseys? He is your best player.)

Here, a burger cooked "medium" really means medium....not medium well! Thank you!!! It was pink in the middle and held together nicely. I ate a California burger (avocado, swiss, sprouts) plus bacon. I didn't really want the sprouts but the roughage can't hurt. Along with the side of fries and tax, my total was $10.83, making this a very good deal. And by the way, the cook those fries in a very tasty oil. I even ate up the small little crunchy fry bits.
author: Mike H.

description:
Hmm not quite sure the burgers are that good. The meat was good but you only get one small patty for your $8 and that doesn't include fries. The bun is quite tasteless and low quality.
I also don't like that they put another ketchup in the heinz ketchup bottles. 
On positive note they are friendly and the place is very clean.
author: Ddc C.

description:
It's a pay first sit down kind of place. 

Service:
Not very friendly, but they are very quick. You basically serve yourself after you pay. But that's what I like.

Food:
The burger was okay, nothing too special. I wish they would toast the bun a little. Maybe I'm being a little bias, but this place doesn't have a condiment bar like the other better burger joints. They just give you lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickles. But what if I want brussel sprouts? Or olives? They don't have any of those. 

Parking: 
They tricked me here. You think they have a parking lot in front of the plaza, but it's all metered. 

Overall:
This place is okay and the price is reasonable. But there are better burger joints out there. Would recommend if you want a quick bite.
author: Christina L.

description: Good food, friendly staff. Kind of confusing with no "order here" sign or vocal staff, but we figured it out ;). Plenty of parking on a Sunday afternoon. Only a couple other patrons ate with us. Good stop if going from SF back to San Jose.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Surprised dad for lunch and took him for a burger and fries. He mentioned it was alright, at best. The bun got soggy quick and the burger fell apart so it got hard to eat. Can't say if I would ever go back or not, ok not! Second star goes to the nice family that owns it but foods just not that good.
author: Prima D.

description:
My first time here was me calling in an order and then picking it up. Words of advice, please make sure that you have them read back your order to you to make sure it is correct. All of it.

Long story short: When I was told it would take them only 5 minutes to make the burger, i asked whether they could hold off making the burger for 10 minutes so I could have enough time to get to Tower Burger from where I was coming. I received an answer in agreement.

I thought this solved the time issue. It hadn't. I arrived and noticed that my food was ready and sitting in a plastic bag on the counter. I asked when it came up and the woman behind the counter said that she did not know. She then read the order which said to have the food ready at 7:10p. NO... I said start then, not be ready then. After fruitless discussion, I just took my cold, sad burger and left. 

It was tasty for a cold, sad burger, perhaps that's where another star was added.

Not the best first experience there and i'm not likely to come back. Unfortunate, but there are other burger joints in the area.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Towers above.

It's a trek to get to the top of Market Street. Amazing Twin Peaks views await. So does a rather good burger. 

First choose between beef, turkey, chicken and veggie. Then pick a creation. You'll find plenty of innovation with cheeses, sauces and even chili.

It was the chili that made my veggie burger something better than usual. Homemade and perfect for dipping and/or putting between the wheat bun. I did both and it was a sloppy, delicious mess.

Don't hesitate asking for a side of their homemade BBQ sauce. Makes things even sloppier and more delicious. All yours for about eight bucks.

Sides like Mitchell's milkshakes and chili cheese fries available too.

Enjoy the walk up. Then get yourself the burger you deserve.
author: Jason B.

description: Delicious cheeseburger, fast service, giant portion of fries. 3 minute drive up to Twin Peaks for a burger and a view!
author: Elliott S.

description: California Burger.. avocado, sprouts, the patty, mMmmmm i love it!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I didn't expect to find a good burger in a strip mall. They're in a location you wouldn't expect - at the foot of Twin Peaks in a quaint little shopping area. 

Tower Burger rivals the Bistro Burger, Burger Joints and Burgermeisters of the world. They serve only Niman Ranch meat. Their chicken sandwich is juicy - not dry like other burger places. Their parking lot makes it a convenient stop and they're decently priced (under $8).

Make sure to specify how you want your burger cooked because they won't always ask. In which case, you'll end up with medium. 

*cringe*
author: Mariela D.

description:
It was 3 PM and we were starving after going up and down numerous set of stairs carrying boxes and suitcases since 9.  

With our things still in boxes at the new place (and whilst wondering what we're signing up for when we decided to move into a single family home after all these years of living in a condo), we didn't feel like anything fancy and Tower Burger was the first entry that shows up when I did a Yelp! search.  

It was only 0.2 miles up Portola Dr from our new pad, so we decided to walk to check out the new neighborhood at the same time.  

Tower Burger was exactly what I expected of a cheap burger joint - open kitchen (strangely, no greasy smell), lots of utilitarian tables and chairs everywhere, and a counter behind which stood a teenager.  

We quickly ordered.  Mine: mushroom burger, medium rare with a side of onion rings, his: bacon cheeseburger, medium rare with a side of fries for a total of $21.

The onion rings and the fries were nothing special, however the burger was another story.  My tastebuds are not sensitive enough to be able to tell fresh Niman Ranch beef from their frozen no-frills counterpart, but they were well-trained enough to know that the beef tasted amazing.  

Next time we'll try the milkshake made of nearby Mitchell's ice-cream!
author: Ange L.

description:
Burger Beef = Niman Ranch - All of the different options will make your taste buds   happy you made the trip over. Worth the price in general.

-Western Burger
-Classic Burger
-Hawaiian/Teryaki

Fries = Not too oily, not too fried and dried, just right if you don't eat it all at once that is, lol.

Ambiance: Cozy and Casual, tucked away in a neighborhood with a view, perfect.

Parking - Not usually a problem. It's metered but away from being hit by traffic.
author: Eric C.

description: I really enjoy Tower Burger's burgers, grilled cheese and milkshakes! The atmosphere is casual and the staff is amazing!
author: C B.

description:
Professional, professional, professional. 
This place's settings says everything about them.

-SUPER clean bathroom. 
-FAST service.
-Taste amazing every time. 

It sounds like small things but there ain't many restaurant it can do that!
author: Coko K.

description: First time coming here with my friend and I like the place. Lots of natural lighting, room, and etc. I tried their Hawaiian burger and it was pretty good. A little on the pricey side but worth it. The fries don't get soggy as fast and the burger patty was cooked exactly like I wanted so I love it!
author: Maile W.

description:
Tower's bordering on pricey, though, $10 for a burger meal is about the standard now in this town.  I still know I can get the same combo for less elsewhere.  Offerings are similar to Bistro Burger.  It seems like there's a hoard of veggie options, but there's really just two:  a mushroom burger or a gardenburger with numerous topping selections.  While not as generous with the fries, they were cooked to perfection, and that beats fistfuls of soggy fries any day.

Coming in with the impression of a small, greasy diner, it was a lot cleaner and larger than I had expected.  Run by sweet folks, Tower Burger's a total godsend if you happen to be stuck in this area.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Much bigger restaurant inside than it looks from the outside. The burgersh are nice, perfect size for me. A good 1/4 pounder+. the service is very fast and the burgers are very good. I also had fries and they were excellent also. I think a lot of the service there is take out,more people were in and out than were in the restaurant . I would eat there again no problem, if I wanted a good burger I would still go to The Bulls Head, but this is next in line.
author: Keith K.

description:
Great burgers, incredible milk shakes. 
But thats what the place is about, the cheesteaks arent as good, nor are the sandwiches. They make excellent onion rings and fries as well.
I normally go for their Tower Burger, medium. 

The thing about their milkshakes is that they use Mitchells ice cream.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Pretty solid burger spot. I wouldn't say they use a super high quality meat for the burgers but definitly above average. I usually get their house salad with blue cheese dressing(really good). Also the fish and chips always hit the spot. 

I keep going back to this place even though I don't live in the area anymore because of the friendly service. Everyone has always been nice and accommodating.
author: Greg Poupon M.

description: Don't let the high stars fool you; this place makes bad burgers, soggy onion rings, and have awful customer service. They tried to rush us through our order even though there was no one behind us. I assume it's rated high because a lot of high school kids eat here and don't know any better.
author: Kimball B.

description: Made the mistake of ordering Cobb salad -- lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber were not fresh at all, and the grilled chicken seemed like it was made in the morning. Should have stuck to burgers here.
author: Satish G.

description:
I only get hamburgers or cheeseburgers here -- no fries. Why so stingy? Because prices are a bit high. Yes, they use Angus or Niman beef but should a simple hamburger (no cheese or fries, mind you) cost almost $7. I think not. The food is good. Don't get me wrong. But, I think I should be able to get a bit more bang for my buck. 

Service is good. The people are friendly and your order is prompt. Nevertheless, I tend to avoid this place unless I am in need for a burger and I'm too lazy to drive (I'm walking distance from this place.) 

3 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE! What an idiot she was! After three telephone orders for pick-up, they got our orders wrong each time!  I called to let them know I was returning to get my order corrected. The last and final time my order was wrong I got a lecture from the old broad because I asked for a 'burger, no cheese.' The bitch said I should have ordered a 'Tower Burger!' Furthermore, my order was supposed to come with bacon. The broad then told me she was going to charge me again for the bacon since she had to cook my burger again! Are you that stupid? You just got a negative review and now you've lost a customer who will dissuade anyone and everyone I come into contact for paying for your mistake! What an idiot! Yes I am mad!
author: Denny L.

description: Not bad, but not really great either. Came here the other day because I was in the area and it was close by. I ordered my food and waited for a bit. It wasn't an unusual amount or anything, but wasn't that fast. The burger I got was acceptable, but nothing out of this world or anything. Just average considering the price.
author: Jeffery H.

description: For years my husband and I considered this a little neighborhood gem. Wonderful quality big hamburgers and french fries to die for. The french fries are still great, but when I bit into my burger, I noticed a much lower quality of meat. full of grizzle, fat, and not very appealing. I was so disappointed!!!  Note to owners: DON"T lower your standards! We have come to rely on them! If you need to raise prices, do that. Don't serve inferior product!!!! Please!!!
author: Nancie M.

description:
Unassuming, clean, nice atmosphere, down-to-earth.

The young man who took our order was friendly & nice.  The order came out accurately & fairly quickly.  My burger was great.. toasted bun, tasty & juicy patty, cheese melted over the patty, cool tomato.  Fries were excellent!  & I love my fries, so trust me, these were fabulous!  Golden & slightly browned, hot, with crisp edges, mmmmm.  

My bf also loved his root beer float.  I didn't try it, but I love that Tower Burger makes floats.  I'm a sucker for nostalgia, what can I say?
author: Rebecca M.

description: Great veggie burger selections--- really great menu in general! Can customize burgers to be veggie, meat, chicken... appreciate that a lot, as it can be hard to please people when dining with a group. Food is always fresh. Service is friendly. Never messed up a to-go order, and my husband and I order from here pretty often, so that's a big plus. Quick service and great food.
author: AnneMarie H.

description: This place used to be friendly and good for a quick bite ... Doubt I'll ever go back after ordering and then asking me to take our food to go ... There was more than 30 min to "closing" but they said we couldn't eat there even though we said we would finish eating before closing time.
author: Denise L.

description: I love trying out local places, am actually glad I did this one. The Fish N Chips smelled really good but I opted for a California Burger...the beef is really good, but they can use some better higher quality buns, or let them toast a bit. Like someone else said about theirs, my bun fell apart too.Other than that really good burger. I was a little annoyed about the side of fries being 4 bucks (not included with burger) but you get a generous portion so that's good. Service could be dramatically increased. The lady who took our order was trying to rush us when clearly we were off to the side looking at the menu since it was our first time, and she didn't smile. She looked rather annoyed. Girl like, CALM DOWN. There is NO ONE behind us in line and it is not busy. That's the problem with most local small businesses, they think they don't have to give good customer service just because they aren't big and corporate smh. The guy who gave us our food was nice though. I'll still be back.
author: Marquis A.

description:
I was sooooo excited to go get a bacon cheeseburger. I had been under the weather for over a week eating nothing but soup and bland food and had an enormous craving for a burger. Unfortunately Tower Burger let me down. 

The people ordering in front of us were told by the guy working "we close in 10 minutes, you need to take it to-go". So much for feeling welcome. Our food was up in less than 10 minutes and of course we took it to-go. The onion rings and french fries were very good, the burgers eh not so much.
