We both ordered our burgers medium rare but mine came out well done. Very well done. Yuck. Also both burgers were charred in a bad way. They tasted burnt and left an awful taste in my mouth. Neither one of us finished our burgers. 

I might give Tower another chance but with so many other places in SF to get a burger it won't be anytime soon. 

peace, love, and good booze ~ chase
author: Chase S.

description: Tower Burger is the business!  This place is family owned and the food is great.  There is a number of places to get a salad or burger or chicken sandwich in the area, but for my money, Tower Burger is peer-less.
author: SummerSalt Villa T.

description: Ordered Hawaiian burger. Not bad. Not too pricy. Two burgers, one order of fries one order of onion rings, water= $22.14
author: Ben M.

description:
Delish chicken sandwich and it's huge! Needed to save 1/2 for lunch the next day. The fries were just the way I love too- well cooked but long and with enough potato flesh that they are slightly flimsy... Perfect for sopping up ketchup (aka Red Death). 

Good place to support a local eatery - especially with Mollie Stone so close by!
author: Megan D.

description: Tower burger discriminates against teenagers. For example, fries are 3.50 but they charge 4 for teenagers during lunch time at the nearby school. Also, when an adult brings in outside food, the employees wouldn't say anything or they'd kindly ask to put their food away. However, when a teenager brings in outside food, the employees scold them and rudely say "this is not allowed. no outside food." Despite the rude workers, the food there is very good and freshly made.
author: Angela R.

description: Disappointed with the chili cheese fries. Too much beans and it really wasn't good at all. The fish and chips were greasy. I think I should've gone to Wienerschnitzel  instead for chili fries
author: Nina C.

description:
This is a nice and simple local burger spot. Not big on decor or themed style and that is just fine. I would rather have friendly service, low wait times, and a great burger than a pretty place to eat it. So they get 4 stars for being what they should be base don what service they are providing.

My order was a standard burger, rings, and a coke. It was ready to go in a few minutes and soon enough I was enjoying that tasty burger.
author: Nick B.

description:
Now I was a little skeptical because of the generic name of this place, but damn, I was proven wrong. Tower Burgers is a diamond in the rough.

When arriving there, I was pretty amazed at how clean the place was. Honestly looked more like a real deal restaurant than a burger joint. 

Now with the burgers......pretty damn good. This place boasts Niman Ranch beef; therefore, I was expecting a juicy ass burger. I ended up ordering the mushroom burger with a side of onion rings.

The guys at Tower Burger were nice enough to hook it up with a free drink. Great burger. Very tasty onion rings. This place is definitely the best spot in the area.
author: Michael W.

description: We got a cheeseburger to go...  We'd go back in a heartbeat...  She got the Sweet Potatoes fries, and she loved them...
author: CDR JAY C. O.

description:
The food is good, not great, and a bit overpriced especially considering you order at the counter then are given a number for your table for the food to be delivered. I'm giving 3 stars because the food I've gotten before, burgers and fries, fish and chips, were consistently good. 

Last night I went with a friend and we both ordered burgers with a side salad, one diet coke and one ice tea and the bill was $25! He had a bacon cheeseburger, cooked medium, and he requested no bun, extra lettuce as he is low-carbing. I asked for my burger to be medium well. Both were served to us without buns even though I never requested that! It was corrected promptly but my date felt awkward starting before me. The side salads were fairly large but your basic green lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, one slice of cucumber and croutons. My burger arrived the second time and I thought it was tasty. My friend's burger was a bit dry even though his was cooked less than mine, not sure how they accomplished that? 

The ice tea I ordered was made to order.... with fresh brewed tea. otherwise you get your own drinks from the soda machine. 

Next time I will insist on going to the Bullshead.
author: ALEXIS S.

description: I had a hawaiian burger. Perfectly cooked and meat was juicy. Next time Id like to try the tower burger. Will definitely recommend.
author: Jun K.

description:
This is bad. Bad Bad Bad.  
A local, mom & pop burger joint WALKING distance (at least from me) that serves only NEIMAN RANCH beef, with great topping options, good prices, AWESOME ONION RINGS (not too much batter, crispy w/ the onions that don't all come out in one bite) AND milk shakes???????????????????  Please check back to make sure I am still a healthy weight and haven't gone there every single day of the week, just 3 times max.  =)  Did i mention the AMAZINGLY PERFECT onion rings?  It will make you forget the lack of vibe.
author: Barndi K.

description:
I came here today with a friend because Creighton's was closed. 
I was like "mmm burgers & fries" since burgers and fries sound very appealing to me. 
But I felt that a veggie burger for around $7-$8 that plain is not worth it. It didn't taste very satisfying. It just tasted better with fries.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Pretty good, but not outstanding. They use Niman Ranch beef, but the burgers are pretty thin. Still, they do a decent job getting them properly done to your order -- my med-rare burger was pretty darned close to med-rare.

Supermarket-style sesame seed buns... eh. The fries are serviceable at best; the rings are pretty bad. Good shakes, made with Mitchell's ice cream, but no malt!?
author: anita c.

description:
Fab burger. Fast service. Wonderful family owned place. They can get super busy, but if you time it right - it can be totally empty.

Went recently during one of our latest storms, parked right in front and ran in with my 2 year old. They were so helpful! We got there at like 11 am and there were like 4 other people there - and since my daughter decided to scream her butt off it worked out well. The owner even gave her a lollipop - which was a blessing. I enjoyed my lunch, chatted with my Dad all while she became a sticky mess. 

Plus, TONS of parking :D
author: Jenny L.

description:
Good Burger, and the fries were hot hot hot. i'm a Burger snob so... i cant go a full 4 but i'd give them a solid 3.5. However, i did order the California without sprouts to go, and when i opened it there were sprouts... so be clear when you order. everything else was spot on and fast, nice service.

BTW. the Mitchell Bros Ice Cream Shakes looked Amazing!
author: Adam X.

description: Burgers are decently priced and pretty good. They are pretty quick with getting their food out too which is a huge plus for me. Also the Asian girl working there was super nice and super hot
author: Jack W.

description:
This place has REALLY good burgers and fries.  My mouth is actually watering right now as I type this and think about the burger I ate there.

The place has a very spacious feel to it.  The inside is kind of whatever, but it doesn't matter to me if the food is really good (and it was).

I ate what I think they call their Tower burger.  Sooooooo tasty.  Loved it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
To be quite honest, I have only had the cheese burgers here and I love them!

I don't like to mess with a good thing, so if I'm in the mood for a sure thing I come here. Nice, juicy, jack, burger with fresh produce and piping hot fries.

The guy and girl behind the counter are so nice and always have a smile on their faces. The food is done in no time and cheap.
author: Kelly N.

description:
Awesome experience with the Hawaii burger.  Meat was juicy and flavorful, fries were crispy and well flavored instead of soggy and too salty or bland.  The fries and the onion rings both kept their flavor and crisp towards the end of the meal, which doesn't happen often and is certainly pleasant when it does.

Solid, solid burger joint.  The waiter Dave was kinda cool, he hooked us up with free drinks (tho he told us to go grab it on our own lol).
author: Hiro K.

description:
Came here based on Yelp reviews and you guys didn't come through for me.

Clean and sterile could describe the location and burgers.  Meh...
author: iPunchfish -.

description:
After working out at the gym (im a personal trainer) i decided to stop by to check out tower since it was on the drive home, and it would be a good stop to get my protein intake and enjoy a nice burger and onion rings since it was my day off from my strict diet.

the burger was good, but it definitely was not worth the price.

its my first time eating there and i was disappointed. $16 for a western burger, coleslaw, and onion rings, which by the way i only got 6 freaking rings!!!! what the hell man!!!! 

i would not go back there again, for people that don't care about spending 16 dollars for something thats going to leave you hungry then its a perfect fit. other places like Sliders offers better burgers and more quantity for your buck.

Dont be tricked by the reviews of this place.
author: Jett J.

description: Da boygers rock after a day of hiking.
author: Peter O.

description: This place is a hidden gem of a burger place.  Every time I drop by, the burger is always consistently good.  Don't get thrown by the reasonable price of the burger, like I did.  Every time I come, sit and bite into the burger, I always think to myself, "This is a pretty tasty burger".  This is a definite best burger place, and I've been to a number of 'best burger' joints.  Tower Burger's burger is right up there.  Don't forget to get fries too.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Wai T.

description:
Burger restaurants are very hard to judge, you order one burger and that's the only one to critique. If it was just a burger you imagined, then it's truly nothing special. I guess I'm a burger fanatic. Since the Burger Bar in Las Vegas, nothing else is comparable. 

The Western Burger had mayou, which I didn't like, I thought it didn't considering it was a Western Burger. That killed it for me. The onions on it should of been grilled instead of being raw. I enjoy the Niman Ranch beef cooked medium and the french fries were freshly hot which I really like.

I would create a special weekly menu with people that have special orders, maybe making a special after them. That would earn another star, another one would be the interior decor which is kinda dull.
author: Stanley K.

description:
VERY nice burger joint.  High quality EVERYTHING.  That said, the prices aren't that great.  A burger with fries will set you back at least 10 bucks.  Well worth it though if you ask me.  Why?

-a medium-rare burger is indeed medium-rare
-a side of onion rings is always SIX.  no more, no less.  consistency is good!
-chicken strips aren't the best, but hey, it's a burger place after all.
-perfect amount of each condiment on burgers.  it's not too little where you would feel skimped, but it's also not piled on so when you take the first bite the whole burger falls apart.
-niman ranch beef.  'nuff said.
-friendly atmosphere! (even the cook is friendly!)

So if you're in the Twin Peaks area and feel like eating at a top shelf burger joint (after all, it's the highest restaurant in The City elevation-wise), go to Tower Burger.  If you're bringing the family, don't forget your Credit Cards because it adds up quickly!
author: Alex S.

description: I was kind of blown away when 2 burgers, a fountain drink, a beer and a few fries and onion rings rang up to close to $25. Huh. Completely, agree with reviewer DDC C, I noticed immediately that the bottle of ketchup had been refilled with some cheapo ketchup. That's weak. The napkins were cheap, too. It was also obvious our burgers were pre-cooked, as we ordered them medium-well and they got to our tables in about 4 minutes and were not that hot. I was thoroughly unimpressed with the value and the taste and will not be returning.
author: James L.

description: good prices for great burgers. the servers are friendly and service is fast. bathrooms are CLEAN :)  They keep things simple.  if you dont want to be in line at In n Out or Five Guys for 30min for a burger, try this place.
author: Pingkian S.

description:
Yelp included this place in a write-up about burgers (1 paragraph was devoted to veggie burgers). This is a little strange bc Tower doesn't make veggie burgers in house - they just cook a gardenburger up a bunch of different ways. That's fine & all, I was just a little misled by the Yelp email.

Anyway, this place was fine. Not as good as Barney's, but fine in a neighborhood standby kind of way. It's a large space so it's good for groups or families. It was oddly quiet for how large it is.
author: Shal J.

description:
i am in LOVE with their mushroom burger! it's super juicy and good. they cook it just right with the meat still a little pink in the center. they also don't skimp on the mushrooms. they have really good onion rings too but you have to order that separately. the price is good and the service is great! fast and friendly.

**they do close at nine so don't think of going there anytime after that**
author: Lynn P.

description:
This is the best burger shop in San Francisco!!!

I ordered Tower Burger, Cobb Salad and Chocolate Milk Shake. I never tasted a great burger until I ate the TOWER BURGER. The meat was sooooo juicy and vegetables tasted very fresh!!! The patty was made from Niman Ranch, which is very good organic beef. The salad was also very fresh. The chocolate flavor of the milk shake was very rich. I thought it was not too sweet; it was JUST RIGHT~ 

The service is very good; they are very friendly and nice. The restaurant is very clean, and the overall atmosphere is very comfortable.

If you want to try the BEST BURGER, go to TOWER BURGER!
I really recommend it!!!
author: Cindy L.

description:
I went into Tower Burger twice in a week and thought it was "pretty good" then I went about my life and realized that I every burger I've had since then just does not compare. 

Its been rough for me. I've tried everything: my friends have tried setting me up with other burger joints; I've played the field, sometimes eating two different burgers in a weekend; I've even experimented with hotdogs.

Nothings worked. Damn you Tower!
author: Matt C.

description:
if your in this neighborhood its a great place for a burger.
not my favorite in town but very good.  I think this place is relly 3.5
author: Glenn T.

description: Very fun neighborhood place.  They have a good menu - including a number of veggie burgers.  Ester & Kim started this place after converting their video rental shop many years ago and worked pretty much non-stop.  Monica now owns the place and does a great job, too.  Lots of people come every week on whatever their 'regular' night is.
author: Woody B.

description:
Damn good burgers here.... 

I had the bacon cheese burger with extra cheese... well done... it was GREAT!! Crispy, thick bacon... good cheddar cheese... fresh toppings... good bun... great fries.... decent prices.... 

Me likes...
author: Jen D.

description:
I always imagine myself eating a super delicious burger in SF , but I haven't had that experience yet. Howeve, that day came when I visited TOWER BURGER and I was so so so pleased!!!!!

These burgers might be the best in the whole U.S, because I have visited so many places within and outside of CA. Nothing did as TOWER BURGER'S did.

Whatever the burger you choose, the taste is fabulous. I guaranteed 100%.

Thanks for the deliciousness!!!!!!!

P.s))) don' forget the ONION RINGS with burger!!!!!!!^^ it's fantastic!!!!!!
author: Jt C.

description:
2.5 

There's no denying they make a good burger here.  Nice beefy patty, great bun, generous toppings.

But for 7 bucks for the burger and 2 bucks more for onion rings...I expect more.

They only gave me 5 onion rings, who does that?  I expected like a basket of 'em.  I expected to have so  much that I have to decide whether to eat 1 more or throw the rest of it away.  But 5?? I mean when did onion rings become tapas?  


I liked the burger but 1 meal cost me about 12 dollars for a hamburger, onion rings and a drink.  Not worth it.  I won't be coming back.  


I'd rather go to nation's.
author: JJ J.

description:
I love burgers and this place gets it right!

I had the Paris burger, grilled mushrooms with a thin slab of brie cheese...oh yeah baby!!!

It was grubbin!

The bf got the bacon cheeseburger and he demolished it...

I'll be back again fo sho!
author: Jade B.

description: I came here the other day and I hadn't been here in years.  It was great.  I got chicken fingers and fries, and I loved it all.  The prices were decent and it was fast.  Definitely a nice spot for lunch/dinner.  Very casual.  There were a lot of kids there too, so really kid-friendly in terms of menu and setting.
author: Julia D.

description: If you don't like their Tower Burger, onion rings, and a chocolate milk shake with Mitchell's chocolate ice cream, your taste buds are weak!  Five minute wait for cooked-to-order food.  Quality meats from Niman Ranch, quality ice cream in shakes, and quality service.  Delish.
author: Julie T.

description:
Probably the only reason I ever tried this place is because I live a block away and sooner or later I was bound to wind up too hungry and impatient to cook or to drive anywhere.

You'd think this is just your token strip mall burger place, but they really know how to make a good burger here.  They'll make it however you want, and it's nice and greasy.  The pink-beige walls are very Daly City.  In short, a great, relatively unknown burger dive.
author: Wes M.

description:
Great burgers with lots of options including turkey, niman ranch beef, salads.  They are fast and friendy, dinner for our 5 came up in maybe 10/15 minutes.  All this makes it really kid friendly....no wait, good food and cheap so you don't feel bad if they don't finish everything.  

But what I really like about this place is its "score".  They consistently have the highest score from the regulators at DPH that I have ever seen posted.  Last night, it was 100%.  Whahoo, lets hear it for cleanliness!!!
author: Tracie P.

description:
Although it has probably been a year since I have gone I do remember something about organic beef... 

Regardless, this place is really freakin' good. In fact, whenever I am in town and crashing on Jerry's couch down the street I try and make it a point to make him drive me here and then go up to the towers to burn one down as we munch away our sorrows. After all, food always tastes better when you have a view of the Bay from that high up. Teeheehee... I also always call in the order right before he puts the finishing touches on the splief and by the time we arrive five minutes later the order has just hit the counter.

One word: onion-rings

See how I made "onion rings" into only one word? Like that? Yeah, I betcha did.
author: Justin C.

description:
Tasty burgers and fries, great service, busy at lunch, lots of tables.

The burgers are made with Neiman Ranch beef and are served to you in two halves with all the goodies. Nothing spectacular, just good and tasty. You will enjoy the fries if you like a more solid fry than a squishy one. Napkins and the condiments you need are right on the tables, including two kinds of mustard. Burger + fries + drink = ~ $9.

The store is fairly big with 15 or so tables and it's clean. The korean family who runs the place works hard and provides good service.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Have you ever ordered take-out from a place and been told it'll be ready in five minutes? Better yet - have you ever had this happen every time you've ordered take-out? Well I have and Tower Burger is the place.  

Tower has continually astounded me with their speed and their good juicy burgers. They also make a mean bowl of steaming chili and their shakes are fantastic as well. This is a great place for hangover food because it's not only delicious but also made from high-quality ingredients.
author: Shane H.

description:
Walking up Laguna Honda, on the quest for "THE BURGER", I dreamt of a delicious cheeseburger with bacon, a cozy booth to cuddle up in after a long day of work, and singing along to Mariah Carey and Whitney Houston as I stuff my face with said burger. 

It all happens here.
author: Veronica B.

description:
Solid burger joint with great milkshakes and I really enjoy their Cobb Salad when I'm feeling too guilty to order a burger. 

There is plenty of parking in the lot out front which is a bonus. The main thing holding this review back from five stars is the fries. They're not bad but they're not special either. Only one burger place I've been to though in the entire bay area has both the fries AND the burger done to perfection though. If you're curious, that place is Five Guys.
author: Brad M.

description:
Props for the family-owned burger joint! 
Even though I don't regularly consume burgers (especially prepared with Niman Ranch meat), I just needed to this time around. I ordered the Tower Burger - and it was simply wonderful. Just the right amount of tenderness and juiciness in the beef - medium rare too...aah, simply delightful. The burger will simply take you into burger nirvana and then you will simply forget your current environment for a second or two. Even though I did not order a milkshake, they definitely appear delicious ... so order one. 

And if you're one of those 5-a-day fruit&veggie nut, then order a side salad. It's large enough to satisfy your daily requirement whilst offering some vegetation along with that carnivorous burger. 

Excellent burgers at Tower Burger... I'd come again.
author: Court L.

description:
Good burgers but nothing out of this world.  I liked the variety they offered, and the fact that it was a clean place.  Went there today at 12:30pm and though it was pretty full there was still seating, and the burgers came out within 5 minutes of ordering.  

I had the Paris burger which came with brie and mushrooms.  Not enough Brie was my issue as it only covered part of the burger so I didn't get the Brie in every bite which when having a burger, I like to have happen.  Also the mayo was only put in the middle of the bun, so again, I didn't get the full effect in every bite.  Meat was good though and bun was yummy.  Fries were okay, not too thick and not the super skinny ones either.  

My boyfriend ordered the bacon cheeseburger and pretty much echoed my sentiments, good food but nothing super spectacular despite being made with the Niman Ranch beef.  

Would I come back?  Yeah I would.  But would I sit there on Sunday morning in bed with a hangover and contemplate coming here to cure me of my woes?  Probably not.
author: Denise B.

description:
Ooh snap!!!!!  Another great burger joint in the city!

Bacon cheeseburger is the only way to do it and Tower Burger has it right!  Excellent tasty meat, bacon done right, and cheese properly melted.  Fries were awesome as well as the onion rings (I snaked a few from a friend!)

Decent burger prices, staff is great, and the place is super clean!  

I tend to go bacon cheeseburger whenever I do burgers so I know my bacon cheeseburger, this place is definitely memorable and worth the return trip.
author: Jenn A.

description:
Who knew?  Tower Burger is so unsuspecting....just sitting there in that strip mall on Portola.  But, wow, it's pretty damn great!  I don't eat beef, but the husband does and it makes me happy knowing that they serve Niman Ranch beef....so husband has lower chance of growing breasts due to absence of growth hormones!  

As for their various creative veggie burgers, I love 'em.  The fries too.  This place brought the joy back into my day after some crazy nursing school rotations at Laguna Honda....yikes.
author: Abby W.

description:
This is my standard for which all other hamburgers are rated.  This is a great burger because of the seasoning they use.  And you can buy the seasoning.  They put it on the burgers, they put it on the fries.  I put extra in a little cardboard container and press my fries into it to get more.  

The meat is big but thin and served with really juicy vegetables on a grilled bun.  I actually think the fact that the meat patty is a little thin allows the flavor from the rest of the toppings to really come through in each bite.  And that's not to say they skimp on the mean, there's plenty of if on each burger.  

They are often in the running for best fries in SF.  If they don't win they at least make the list.  And the fries are really good.
author: Sandy F.

description:
As a Miraloma Park resident, I know I always have a good local option to get a great burger.  The Niman Ranch burgers are always tasty and perfectly cooked.  

I wish they had a few more cheese choices (like bleu cheese), but the fries are good, onion rings are good, and the staff is always very friendly.  

A long time ago I ordered a chocolate shake, and got one made with chocolate ice cream rather than the traditional way of vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup.  In my opinion, that's just wrong, but maybe they've switched to the traditional vanilla / choc syrup since then.
author: Bill V.

description:
A good, no-frills burger joint, worth a visit if you happen to be in that part of town.  Fries don't come with - though for $7 I just assumed they did - you have to order them separately.  Which is just as well, though my California burger did look lonely on the big plate all by itself.

I didn't realize the burgers were made from  Neiman Ranch beef until I read some of these reviews.  That explains both the good quality of the burger, and also the price.  But I've had a bad burger before, and I shudder at the memory, so I'll gladly pay a few bucks extra for a good one.
author: DD B.

description:
[4- One of the Best of the Bay]

[STORY BITS--- Scroll Past For Review]
For years my buddy MF, the soon to be mega-watt premium cable show creator, has been raving and ranting at me about Tower Burger. While I was down south recently, as we drove past Tommy's and Fatburger franchisees he openly scoffed.

MF
If I could bring ONE place down here it would be Tower Burger.

NN
That good?

MF
Don't even start me up, baby. I'll make you keep driving till with get back to civilization.

Okay, so it didn't go down quite like that. Yet when Kym and I were figuring out lunch today while I played with my iPhone she declared that she wanted somewhere she could get fries since her Chinese medicine practitioner friend was putting her on an all brown rice diet for a week so she can diagnose an allergy she's been having.

A week without fried foods sounds like hell to me too. What to do? 

Well the new App store made Yelp just a click away. Where can I get fries and a veggie burger close to the Panhandle that doesn't suck?

Oh look, Tower Burger. What a coinkydink!

[REVIEW BIT]

Unlike some Burger Joints... heh... Tower doesn't try and overwhelm you with the burger and fixin's. In fact presentation had me almost scratching my head. "Where's the overload?" I thought.

Yet that was the best part... the portions were perfect. This was just the right amount of Niman Ranch beef cooked precisely to order. Most short order cooks frak up medium well one way or another. The fries are crisp shoestrings that earn a "Best In Class"- with bonus points for Malt Vinegar on the table. 

Kym ordered the veggie burger-- with bacon!!-- and chowed down with pre-cleanse glee.

I walked out feeling not too full and not at all empty, that elusive "just right", and without any of the queasiness I got from the last time I ate at my formerly beloved Nation's.

MF, you were wrong about "Mongol", but soooo right about Tower Burger.
author: Noah N.

description: After reading some reviews here I decided to give this place a try....since I also live close by. Frankly I was not impressed with the hamburger that I ordered...normal bun and additions. Good onion rings though but there are other places with great tasting hamburgers. Everything on the menu is a la cart and credit cards are accepted.
author: Pedro U.

description:
What a burger should taste like. That's what you get at this family owned burger joint.

True Niman Ranch quality beef on a decent bun with just the right amount of lettuce, tomatoes, onions and pickles. The burgers are also super clean, no mess bite after bite. Good burger. 

Onion rings and french fries are good but if you want both, you have to order one of each. Too bad they don't offer a combo...frings would be nice.
author: Rick C.

description: Delicious burgers in a cute little place. Fast and clean serive. Their BBQ sauce is to die for (get the Western Burger)! YUM! :-)
author: Robyn M.

description: Fantastic burgers, not too expensive, friendly people!  However, BurgerMeister is better.  Honestly, I only dinged them a star because BurgerMeister is better.  The ambaince at Tower Burger is very friendly, relaxed, and non pretentious.  Think mom and pop.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Not bad.  Met a friend here for a late bite after school and was surprised to see a woman resembling my mother greet me at the register.    She even gave me the same disapproving look when I ordered cheddar on my burger and a side of onion rings.  :)

I had no expectations when I agreed to go here.  Just had my vacuous buddha to fill with something hot.  The perfectly prepared medium rare burger and toasted bun with fresh fixins and fryer-hot onion rings were a pleasant surprise.
author: Jenny K.

description: My cousin brought me here for lunch and their burgers are so good! They use natural niman ranch beef patties for all their burgers is a bonus for me. Their burgers have a strong char flavor that makes them super yummy! The fries are not greasy at all. Love them crispy fries and onion rings! I always ordered the California burger here which includes avocados and sprouts. I wish they serve buffalo burgers in their menu with option of adding eggs on top! I hope the owner is reading this and listen to my suggestions!!! I will be back!
author: Aylee G.

description:
Dear Tower Burger,
Thank you for being there.  Working across the way at Juvenile Hall can be rough somtimes, but your consistency alleves my anxiety on my darker days.  Your prices are fair and the burgers succeed at re-fueling me, making it so I can take on more violence and tragedy, systemic psychosis, and a few more hours of plying the trade.  Red meat is most popular here but your Paris Burger reigns supreme. (brie and mushrooms top this burger/gourmet comfort fuel)  But if you are trying to stay healthy, the tuna salad is an effective stand-by.
During the school year's noon hour, you get over-run by nearby highschool students and I hesitate at your doors until the bell rings and they empty out.  It's only because I like you with fewer folks, quieter, and more devoted to me.  
Sincerely,
me
author: Jen L.

description:
The red lights of the "TOWER BURGER" sign have been calling to me, as I traveled on Portola, for some time now.  For some reason, I was intrigued.  And, now I know all about it.

Tower Burger is, as Eric M. said, a neighborhood burger joint.  There is no need to schlep here.  If you're in the area or live nearby -- fine.  If not, no schlep for you.

The burgers were average.  Good?  Yes.  Great?  No.  I had a bacon burger with BBQ on it.  I did not love their BBQ sauce but the burger was juicy like I like it.  It did come out super fast so that was a plus.  We were in and out in less than 20 minutes tonight.

It is a little ghetto inside.  They've obviously spent some money on the accent wall paint and the lighting fixtures and on DUCT TAPE.  There is upholstered bench seating along the restaurant's longest wall.  It is ripped in many, many spots.  This has been covered up with duct tape.  Kinda cheesy & tacky if you ask me.  It was hard to find a spot to sit where I wouldn't have to sit on tape.

So, now I know.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Good food in a pinch. I live nearby and work from home often. This place has saved me many times from ordering a pizza or getting into my car and wasting 45 minutes on a mid day food finding odyssey.

The burgers are big, juicy, and flavorful. Salads are bland and don't taste fresh - but that's what you get for ordering salad at a place with burger in its name.

TIP: Skip the fries and go for some onion rings.....mmmm. Then be prepared for a mid afternoon siesta once you've finished your plate.

Oh, how I miss the Doggie Diner.
author: C K.

description: We go here for fries, burgers, milkshakes.  The best way to describe the food is that it tastes like  fries, burgers, milkshakes when you have them as a kid.  They're not fancy, they're just right.  The prices are a bit high but I'm willing to pay for the quality and reliability.
author: gar l.

description:
I would have never noticed this burger joint had Tim not taken me.  It's on Portola right by Twin Peaks, in a small strip mall that reminds me of the suburbs in Ohio.  There are booths and a soda fountain where you can make a suicide.  

Now whenever I'm craving burger, I crave Tower Burger (since In 'N Out is too far).  We went there for dinner yesterday--we shared a cheeseburger (Neiman Ranch beef!), fish n' chips (light and flaky like the tempura in Japan), and a Mitchell's chocolate milkshake.  I was thoroughly satisfied and in a great mood.

It's family owned and worked- Korean folks!  I love nice Korean families.
author: Mijin L.

description: Went here for the first time last weekend and loved it!  8 different styles of veggie burgers, including a veggie chili burger (something I can never seem to find) AND Mitchell's ice cream milkshakes.  Place was quiet, clean and the service was fast and friendly.  If you're in the West Portal area and you need a good veggie burger, this is the place!
author: Heather H.

description: Pretty damn good burger. You can taste the quality of the meat.  The service is friendly and the fries aren't bad, either.  I've tried the onion rings, too, and they're pretty dang tasty.  A-Ok and speedy.
author: Laura M.

description:
First of all, let's get one thing straight -- This is not a destination restaurant like Zuni. People aren't driving in from San Bruno or even Hayes Valley for some Tower Burger. 

TB is a neighborhood burger joint. If you live in Miraloma, Forest Hill, West Portal, Twin Peaks, or Glen Park, TB gets the job done -- a very good burger or chicken sandwich for a decent price by SF standards. 

The atmosphere isn't anything special; in fact, it could probably use an upgrade. But the people are nice, and if you want takeout, your dinner will be ready within minutes of your call. The burgers themselves aren't heavily seasoned, but the extra fixings on top are generous. Yes, fries (not bad) or rings (better) are extra, but you get a mammoth portion that could easily feed two burgered adults. 

All told, Tower Burger serves a satisfying, hot dinner for two that should set you back well less than $20 -- even less if you do take out and drink your own beer at home. And on a foggy night on Portola, what else could you want?
author: Eric M.

description:
This is my FAVORITE Burger Joint in all of the Bay Area!

I love the fact that its a hearty burger joint, yet still intimate enough to talk without having to yell with your friends. I simply devour the Onion Rings! No other place makes Onion Rings the way they do...... yummmmm soOoo good! Burgers are also so juicy and flavorful. 

I'm drooling as Im typing this up. =)

IF you've never tried this Tower Burger... I suggest you try it soon. Its a locals favorite and the customer service is great, they are so friendly and attentive. This is a perfect place to go if you want to unwind and relax in calm environment while enjoying a juicy burger!  (droool...)
author: Sylvia K.

description:
Great burgers made from local quality beef which means you can get a burger that is cooked to order, instead of cooked to the point of no taste. Honestly, if I am not cooking it, this is the best burger I have found in SF.

Only downside is all sandwiches and burgers come with mayo as a standard and on hung over lunch excursions I have a tendency to forget...

Fries rock here. Cooked crispy when you ask. Refeills on sodas and tea are free. Quick easy and painless experience. Plus it close to the house!
author: Shawn J.

description:
This is your standard grill fare with burgers, tuna melts, some salads, and fish-n-chips, but after dancing around the menu, I always come back to the burgers.

This is the food you can get cravings for: thick and plump, oily juices running down your chin, high-quality meat lovin' BURGER.  Partner with some decent fries (not too crisp, not too squishy) and shakes made from Mitchell's ice cream.  Sure, maybe it's not the best burger in the entire city, but when it's close and reasonably priced for what it is, it becomes a gem of the neighborhood.

Staff is ridiculously friendly, service is speedy!  Atmosphere is a little noisy due to layout and being a popular hangout for the gradeschool sports teams families post-game.  But hey, get it takeout: they even go so far as to cut the top corner of your styrofoam box so that the steamy goodness doesn't make your bun and fries all soggy.
author: Gnat M.

description:
Absolutely excellent.  The service is on a par with the food - the fact that they wave hello to me when I come in and wave goodbye when I leave is total aces.

The biggest problem I have with this place is actually choosing what to eat.
author: Jorm ..

description: I live near here and think its the best turkey burger in the city.  Something about it that makes it so incredibly delicious and satisfying.  Love this place!!!
author: Lynda M.

description: If you are looking for a quick burger, fries, and a Mitchells ice cream shake, this place is great!  I live near here and you can get take out in always 5 minutes.  But the best part is the burgers are high quality, the onion rings are so crispy, and the Mitchells ice cream shakes are so wonderful.  It's a great place also for kids.  Standard interior, but wonderful people who work there.
author: Kali H.

description:
My first visit to Tower Burger was a good experience. I felt like my burger was perfectly cooked, and the fixins were fresh. I was glad to see that they use Niman Ranch meats (it seems to becoming a standard 'round these parts).

I gave them another shot tonight, and this time around was a bit of a mediocre experience. The burger, although cooked to my specs, was a bit lackluster in flavor (it didn't even seemed seasoned... even a little salt n' pepper coulda helped) and the bun was a bit soggy. I depended on the condiments to carry the burger.

I will say that I do like their fries. They're fresh and crispy without being too crunchy, yet soft and piping hot on the inside. I can't help but reach in the bag on my way home and pull a few fries out to eat while still hot.

I also appreciate that they vent the styro containers for to-go orders. They were very very quick this time around and I was in and outta there within a few minutes.

Haven't had the shakes or eaten in yet, so I'll prolly give it another chance.
author: Courtney P.

description: I've been here twice and it was pretty good both times. Not the best burger I have ever had but it gets the job done. Food comes out pretty quick and the people who run the store are friendly.
author: Darius A.

description: I come here for the veggie burgers with sauteed mushrooms and swiss, although they do have many options such as salad, soup, shakes, and even beer,and wine  to choose from which I enjoy.The bun is always perfect and fresh.I like the skinny fries also. They have vinegar on the tables and that is a plus, another star for always being fast even when it is very busy.
author: Dee D.

description:
Oh hell yeah.  Get the #4 - bacon cheeseburger.  The bacon gets crisped up just right, and the burger is more than enough for one person (even a foodbag like me).  The fries are well-done as well - crisp and not greasy.  It's easy for a place with a burger like this to skimp on fry quality and give you a limp, greasy offering, because they know you'll come for the burgers anyway.

$8.77 is a fair price for dinner of this quality, and the takeout is quick even when they're busy.  I've never waited more than about 8 minutes for my food, and usually it's no more than 5.

Now, to talk them into delivery...
author: Foodbag B.

description: Very nice decor for a sit-down burger restaurant.  Their Western cheeseburger was more than fulfilling.
author: H K.

description:
I would say they either need to give more quality food or charge less.

If a burger, fries and a soda cost $10-12, they need to be great and BIG. The burger is average size, the drink is very small and the fries while ample, were dry for some reason (hard to get down).

The chicken sandwich on a roll was pretty good. A bit dry though.

The place is roomy and clean and  I found the staff to be helpful and quite friendly, but overall it was over-priced. It is a nice spot really.

I would expect to pay more like $7-8 for a meal here, not the $10-12 that it came out tobe for each of us.
author: Karen L.

description:
This is our favorite neighborhood burger joint and usually go there at least twice a week.  The food is great and the staff is friendly.  

They have Niman Ranch Meat hamburgers with plenty of options and a great chicken ceaser salad when you want something lighter.

I highly recommend this place.  It can be crowed at lunch due to the local schools so if your in a hurry call in your order.

My only wish is for the fries to be a little better.  The tend to be dry.
author: Lalo H.

description: I've been coming to Tower Burger since it opened back in,I'm guessing,2000. I've never been unhappy with the food or the service. My favorite item is the California burger, which has avocado and sprouts(I have them hold the sprouts though). Really any burger I've tried has been good, as have the chicken sandwiches. The people are friendly and the place is always spotless. I used to live right up the street off of Panorama, but even now that I'm on the other side of the City again I will gladly drive here for a quick bite
author: Nick R.

description:
Clean, fast, and high quality beef.  If you're having a meat craving on this side of town - which is not the same thing as a meat craving in the Castro, kids - this is a smart destination.  The fish and chips are (is?) also fresh and good, and not greasy, and the chicken sandwiches are fine.  It's not at all fancy, but fresh and satisfying.

Which I suppose the Castro can be, too.
author: Amy L.

description:
Burger, dripping with brie cheese, with crisp onion rings on the side?  Yes please!

I was craving a veggie burger the other day and decided to stop in.  The burger, with brie cheese and sauteed mushrooms, was delicious.  The service was fast, and though the prices seem a little high, I'd still go again.  It was well worth it!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great burgers, it's what a burger should taste like - all natural beef, good fries (though I am a bigger fan of shoestring fries, these hit the spot). Super fast service, and the family that runs it is always friendly. You can call ahead for take out and it's always ready in 5 minutes. Easy to park, metered - but so is half the city (feed the meters people, meter maids are ALWAYS around here). They do close early (9 PM) so keep that in mind.
author: Marcelo T.

description: Great quality food, fast & friendly service. Clean establishment with very quick service. I like their fish & chips  as well as the burgers!
author: Maria T.

description:
Maybe we were just starving, but tower burger really hits the spot... I still think the best burgers in town are at zeitgeist, but they don't serve 'em all the time so what's a gal to do.

Tower burger has nothing really special about it and it is not worth journeying across town for. But if you live nearby or you happen to be in the area, it is decent burger and fries.

The family who runs the place seem really nice and eager to be helpful.  Although you order at the counter, they bring you your food and try to make it a bit nicer.

When we were there a family birthday party had taken over a bunch of tables -- seemed a perfect place for it. Good for kids- let you bring in a cake -- etc.
author: Jess O.

description:
Tower may not have the quirky atmosphere of Mel or Cable car- but its a heck of a lot cleaner. There is plenty of seating and high-chairs. Food to go, is ready fast (faster even then most drive thrus) and packaged for easy travel. The parking is easy to, they recently installed metered parking which has increased available spaces!! I really never thought I would be happy to see a meter- o this crazy town..
Back to burgers. Towers burgers are huge and juicy. The price point is excellent. (More than fast and less than Cable.) They have a better selection of extras, and you aren't charged extra for every little thing. My personal fave is the Paris Burger with brie and grilled mushrooms. Their fries aren't my favorite..but thats probably for the best!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Basic interior (pretty clean, though they could wipe down the walls), good selection of burgers and sandwiches.  The California chicken sandwich is a tasty treat and the fries are pretty darn good.  

Fast!  If you need to get in and get out, this is the place.
author: Evan G.

description:
This is a pretty darn' good place to get a burger.  Not as good as upper-tier burger joints like Barneys, but a far cry better than Mickey D's.

The shakes are done well, as are the fries, which are never soggy or overdone.  The burgers are large, tasty, and filling.  Tack on the clean (though unremarkable) interior, and reasonably priced fare and that gets you four Yelp stars from me any day!
author: Zachary S.

description:
mMm... Juicy burger....

Every time I pass by here my mouth waters a little, just a Pavlovian response I guess.
Two burgers you must try here: Tower Burger and the California, please get it cooked anything other than well-done
The Tower Burger is amazing, it's so moist thanks to the mushrooms that it oozes, have napkins ready.
The California is kind of interesting, you might be wary of sprouts and avocados on a burger, but it works.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I would have never tried going here but as we all know Big Joe's Broiler #2 has the most ridiculous hours and is never open.  
So...I drove up the hill to Tower Burger to try something from there for the first time.  Looking at the menu I was expecting this meal to be good..there were also several other people in the place so I wasn't scared away at first.  But OMG the burgers are TERRIBLEEE!!!!  I got a veggie burger which tasted SO MUCH worse than the ones you get in the frozen food section at the store.  Ick...  I had my veggie burger with brie and mushrooms and even those tasted bad!!  The brie still had the rind on but was completely flavorless and the mushrooms didn't taste very good, somehow, either.  
Ok, so maybe the problem is just the veggie burger?? Totally not!  My bf gets a bacon cheeseburger and the meat is completely lacking juices..we decided that the cook must press the burgers on the grill so that the meat gets all packed and drained of juices.  Sigh...and if the food couldn't be any worse the chili cheese fries are absolutely disgusting.  It's as bad as drinking ocean water.  They are so salty that we just left the whole $5.99 worth of fries on the plate.
author: Amber R.

description:
Great burgers.  The vegetables they use are very fresh.  Beef is good, but for some reason their burgers don't seem as beefy as other places.

Their fries and onion rings are delicious - perfectly made.

It's pricey as far as burgers go ($7 for a burger alone) but afterwards I didn't feel that I had paid too much.  The burger did an okay job at justifying its price
author: Jon N.

description:
My friend wanted to take me to this place.  Said it was pretty cheap for a good ass burger.  Expected it to be a dingy hole-in-the-wall because that's how most places that are good tend to look sometimes.  I walked in and it was well-lit, decent dining space, and contemporary designed.  The counter person was very nice.

I ordered a California burger and although it says "bean sprouts" is what it comes with, I had a suspicion that they meant alfalfa.  When it came, it was alfalfa sprouts.  Thank God because I cannot handle having bean sprouts with my burger.  But either way, it was on the side.  The burger was $6.99.  I got a drink and left the counter almost $10 poorer.  

They advertise that they use Niman Ranch beef, which is great!  But honestly, I've been to other burger joints who don't say that and their burgers tasted just the same.  I guess it's not really about the taste then, maybe more about the treatment of the cows.  Either way, I would come back as long as I knew I had $10 to spare.
author: Ava T.

description: Tower Burger is jawsome.  Fish and chips are awesome, and the burgers are awesome.  They are better fresh - consumed on-site, but the carry out option works extremely well for families or a night in.  Service is polite, friendly and pretty fast.  Nieman Ranch pattys are good.  They serve beer as well, and the fries are good.  What more could you want?
author: Fiid W.

description:
I am not a hamburger person, but when I do have the cravings or if anyone else would have burger, this would be the place.
This place is clean, the hamburger is tasty. I love the fact that the meat is juicy, yet my the buns ain't soggy, just good honest burger with no gimmick. Love it!
author: John L.

description: Epitomizes mediocre area dining.extra patty an insulting $4. Sandwiches next door better.
author: Collin G.

description:
okay this is my new rating.

i've been here when it first opened after the owner closed down his video movie store.

he made sure he had great beef.  it was going to be either angus or niman ranch beef.

i went in recently and had a burger.  it was burnt a bit which really disappointed me quite a bit.  one side was over cooked and the other side wasn't cooked nearly enough.  how do you do that to a burger?  oh i know...don't hire a cook that is really a cook/chef.

i've ordered the fish and chips...well, before it was good also.  now, you need to make sure the oil was just changed so it tastes fresh.

how do you do that?  you don't you just hope its been done.  i don't think its changed every day like its supposed to be because i've tried going in early hoping that no other burgers/fries/fish have been cooked yet but it still was the same ole oil.

my man either has sold his store or he's never in there.  either way i would rather go to joes broiler on monterey...or bullshead at west portal.
author: Bing D.

description:
my boyfriend and i were planning to go to Japantown for lunch. while we were in the car, i had this weird craving for a hamburger. as we were driving up Portola, i told him "i want a hamburger. you wanna try that burger joint instead?" so we ended up here.

the burgers were yummy. i ordered their "tower burger." for about $7 it came with grilled onions, bacon, mushrooms, cheese, lettuce and tomatoes.  it was good and it totally satisfied my burger craving! too bad it didnt come with fries. but i enjoyed it. i also ordered a strawberry milkshake. btw, they make their milkshakes with Mitchell's ice cream. i believe it was around $5. 

we went to Joe's Cable Car a couple weeks ago. even though Joe's "grinds their chuck daily," this place uses beef from Niman Ranch http://www.nimanranch.com/index.aspx. my bf said he liked this place and it tasted better than Joe's. plus, its cheaper. we'll probably be back one day.
author: B B.

description:
My friends and I were looking for the best burger in the City one weekend.  This place definitely doesn't have it.  

Decent burger that you might cook at home or at a bbq.  

What really enticed us about this place were the onion rings, but those were entirely disappointing.  Undercooked and greasy, I couldn't force myself to finish them.

Won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Sam G.

description: This no-nonsense burger joint in the Miraloma Park neighborhood can take your order over the phone and have it ready in five minutes. Not haute cuisine by any stretch, but solid.  The business is family-owned and -staffed, and I do enjoy their friendly and high-energy attitude.
author: Geoffrey C.

description: Had the Cali burger which tasted kind of bland but decent . Their fries were pretty yummy though ...
author: Eileen L.

description:
Love this place!  Good burgers, fries, tuna melts, veggie burgers.

Tower Burger is also kid friendly.
author: J H.

description: If you want a pretty good, relatively inexpensive burger, Tower Burger is the place to go. They service is really fast and they have a bunch of vegetarian options. The milkshakes are too expensive and not very big, but its a solid burger joint.
author: Evan B.

description: Had the Tower Burger and the Tuna Salad here today for a late lunch.  Fast Service, easy parking and clean establishment.  Burger was cooked the way I ordered it and with everything a burger is suppose to come with.  Wanted to try the fish and chips that people raved about but was avoiding the fried foods today.  Next time, fries and beer too!!!
author: Ray Y.

description:
Selection:
Considering this is a burger joint, Tower burgers has lots of veggie options like the Portabella mushroom, california veggie (with avocados and sprouts), veggie Paris burger with brie and mushrooms and several others. They also have turkey burgers, sandwiches, salads and fish and chips.

Value/Quality:
I usually order the veggie chili burger with fries. At $ 6.25 The portion of fries (that you have to pay extra) seems generous and the chili is satifying for a good eater like me. The lettuce and tomato are always crisp and the food is hot, even for pick-up orders.

Location/service
The School of the Arts is near by, it gets crowded on weekdays around lunch time. I get my orders to go, you can always call ahead.  Mama and junior always take your order FAST without ever being rude or dismissive! They are lovely people, very efficient.  Now, if I could get them not to be stingy with the ketchup packages with to-go orders.....
author: Raul A.

description: I tried this tonight, I have to say inexpensive delicious and friendly. The burgers were awesome!
author: Margaret B.

description: I used to live in Twin Peaks and Tower Burger was a staple. As a vegetarian, I'm not used to having choices for my veggie burgers, but at tower burger I had around 6! The burgers are great (my husband is a meat eater and likes the regular burgers too).
author: Niki S.

description: There aren't too many places in SF I would call a staple but Tower Burger sure gets my vote. Secluded up at the top of Diamond Heights this is no diamond in the rough. Surrounded by an affluent community, Tower Burger's smoke stack permeates the neighborhood with BBQ-esque  type smells that makes the local vendors salivate. The Tower Burger with cheese, bacon and mushrooms is the top hit and with a side of rings you're sittin pretty. This place is also the cleanest burger establishment I've been in and the quality of food is outstanding. I just wish they made an original philly cheese like the ones I get back east, that way I could kill two birds with one stone.
author: Jason C.

description: OK... It's really 3.5 stars.  The best thing here are burgers and the meat is great.  Points off are for the buns (and I don't mean onthe server).  The buns are tooooo much bread and sometimes dry.  Otherwise everything about this place is great!... The parking, the burger, the onion rings, the beer.  If only they had smaller buns.  or maybe toasted...
author: p w.

description: I was craving a burger that wasn't "fast foodie." So I tried Tower Burger! Never have had a bad burger from here!  They are delicious and right up the street from my house.  Always cooked just the way I order it! There is ample metered parking out front.  The service I have experienced is usually friendly and polite but can vary depending on who is working the counter.  I really don't like the fries.  They are soggy.  I wish they had sweet potatoes fries!  The service is mediocre. Not bad if you are looking for something quick.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Had take out from Tower Burger and it was overall pretty tasty (yeah, take-out isn't the best approach for burgers).  Both burger and fries were just a tad, uhm, damp; not damp enough for the "soggy" word (hmm: at what point does damp become soggy?).  I attribute this more to the containers and it being take out than anything else.  This had the effect of making a quarter of the fries limp.  

Would rate this three stars given the meal, but being nice because hell, it is a take out burger for goodness sake...
author: Evan D.

description: Okay, the food here is average for a burger place.  But on my visit I witnessed some really shocking food handling practices. Being in the food industry, I know the requirements of sending all of your employees to California food handlers training, having a certified Serv-safe manager working at all times, etc. When I pointed out the unsanitary food practices these employees were using, the person I was speaking to asked me "what is wrong with that?". I watched them take plates from the dining room back to the kitchen, take food off those plates, put that food on other plates and re-serve it to other customers. The cooks were using their hands for everything from touching the dirty handles of cooking equipment to wiping surfaces with dirty towels, then using those same bare, unsanitized hands to grab a handful of fries to plop alongside a hamburger on the next plate that came their way.  I don't work for the health department, but it doesn't take a genius to know these are easy ways to spread food borne illness.  DINER BEWARE
author: Kim K.

description: Love the California Burger (although I'm normally not a burger person):  Niman Ranch beef (no hormones, no antibiotics), monterey jack, tomato-lettuce-pickle, avacado, sprouts-- mmmm
author: Bunny C.

description:
I've been here a couple times and there ares some things that i really like about this place.  It's easy to park, the burgers and fries have good flavor.  The dining area is also very, very clean which i do appreciate very much. and they take credit cards.

Unfortunately, there are also things i really don't like (hence the 2 stars). The portions are smaller than the competition and its more expensive for a smaller burger.  I don't quite understand all the talk about inexpensive.  the burgers come al a carte with no fries or anything so you have to pay for it seperately.  burger and fries for upwards of 13 bucks?  not cheap.  For my money, i'm going to burgermeister.  harder to park and must have cash but the food is better and bigger.
author: frank r.

description:
who frackin knew old korean farts can make some damn good burgers. 

sure its no eugetastic burger, but hey, not everyone can be euge.
author: Euge L.

description: Ate there again today, the French fries tasted a bit "fishy," like they'd been cooked in the same oil as the prawns, perhaps. Not major, but all the same, it shouldn't be that way, and if you're allergic to fish it could be drastic.
author: Ron G.

description: Very nice people, and decent food.  This place is just down the block, so I end up eating there once a week.  The food's good, and offers a wide selection of both beef and "veggie burgers" for multiple diets.  The fries are OK, but nothing special.  The onion rings are quite good.  Their salads are simple, but large and fresh.  They also make their own iced tea, which seems to be a rarity in the area.  (Does anyone actually LIKE Nestea???)
author: Kevin H.

description: Very delicious chicken sandwich that was at least 50% bigger than other places. Vegetables were fresh and tasty. Condiments at your table instead of packets. Very clean bathrooms. Nice 80s music in the background.
author: Wes W.

description: jeepers but I love this burger haven ! the cheeseburger w/cheddar is yumm-o and the mushroom burger ? Heavenly good. I've also had a delectable grilled cheese sand (your choice of cheese & bread) -- what is more pleasing than melting cheese on crunchy buttered toast, hmm ? nothing, that's what. screw the arteries, gimme all that cheese
author: Prima D.

description: I love the fact that even though the place was packed,  our food  arrived to our table only 7 minutes after we ordered. The quality of beef here is excellent. I had the bacon cheeseburger, fries, and a Coke, and my honey had a bacon cheeseburger with a chocolate shake. Ice cream fans will love that they use MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM in the shakes! So good! We really enjoyed the clean, family friendly environment. I will definitely go back to Tower Burger when I am in S.F.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
you'd never guess by lookign at this place that the food would be anything special but there burgers are cooked PERFECTLY and they don't skimp on the fixings.

plenty of parking, too, for those of you who don't mind ponying up $4.50 per gallon.
author: Jeremy D.

description: oh, YUM. i have to admit, as a Mission girl my favorite burger place is Big Mouth...but if I'm in the area, Tower Burger is definitely the place for a satisfying serving of some really good burger. They have a variety to choose from, including burger, veggie burger, and whatever else you expect to find at a joint like this. AND they actually give you real plates, too--a definite plus. Spacious and clean, it looks like it could accommodate a heck of a lot of people. I love that they keep it simple, but I can imagine this place getting to be really huge and popular with a bit more traffic.
author: Josephine J.

description: Fair and decent burger for a fair and decent price in a clean restaurant. They serve beer as well.  Watch out for the meter readers in the parking lot. I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.
author: Don m.

description: The burgers at this restaurant are so amazingly delicious.  The fries are tasty and not overly crunchy.  The shakes are thick and good.  The service is great, people there are friendly.  I know it is pricey, and a lot of people complain about it , but you know  I think the price is worth it!!  I'm so glad I live within walking distance from this place, it is such a great place to go to just to go and get a burger.
author: Justin F.

description: The food is ok for what it is, but it is no way near worth dropping $7.50 for a bacon cheese burger that doesn't even come with fries, and then paying $3.40 for a tiny side of fries.  Once I've spent $11 for just the burger and fries at a place where you order at a counter and then take a number (aka no wait staff), I start thinking of all the better places I could eat for the same money.  And don't bother spending $3.50 for onion rings... I did that once and got maybe 5 rings... that's $0.60 per slice of onion.
author: Adam R.

description: I haven't been to this place for a while. However I jest went yesterday again for the first time in like couple of yrs. It was good back in the day and it still is. The burgers are fairly priced, portions were good and the taste was great. They have changed the ppl that work there tho. The fries are awesome!
author: Jonathan W.

description: One of their surprising specialties is their Cobb Salad. Hands down my favorite salad in San Francisco. Just ask for extra dressing.
author: John B.

description: I used to live across the street. Hands down, best burgers under $10 in town. Tower Burger with mushrooms is my fav.!!!
author: MihaSF N.

description:
Definitely one of the favorite burger places in the city. However, I'm refraining from giving a 5 star because of the price. The food is fast, solid fries and the burger is probably one of the better ones I've had. There's also endless self-serve fountain drinks too.

In contrast to what some of the terrible reviews were, I've never once had a bad experience here. Maybe I was lucky?
author: Richard C.

description:
so had 30 minutes for lunch while working at laguna honda hospice and found the closest place to eat.  this place was nice considering it was a plaza.  this place says that they use niman ranch beef but i didn't pick up on any difference.  

i'll give them that service is very quick. we ordered then sat down at our table and our burgers came out within about 5 minutes.  that was quick.  their fries were great, nice and crispy.  they either just changed their oil or they make sure its nice and fresh cause you didn't tast any other foods.  you know when you can taste other fried stuff from the old oil.  non of that at this place.  

the meal is moderately priced and this place gets pretty packed for lunch so if you go make sure you beat the crowd.  oh and their lunch crowd also has high school kids too so if you don't want that then go after the rush.
author: junie k.

description: I walked up the hill with my partner, against the roaring wind and blowing fog to try out this burger place.  The woman taking our orders was business-like, not particularly friendly, but ok. We both ordered the Western burger, he rolled his eyes at me 'cause I always read his mind and order what he wants before he can say it. I ordered fries, he onion rings.  The ambiance was drab strip mall. 75% empty. We sat by the window for the extra light.  Most of the other patrons seemed worn out and sad, I was happy to be sitting in the glow of my beloved's smiling face. The burgers arrived fairly quickly.  The ultra thin slice of cheese barely melted, the buns quick charred, and the most miserly drab of barbeque sauce I've ever seen applied to a western burger. I ended up apply a liberal dose of ketchup to make the hamburger ok. It isn't a terrible burger, but its below average. The fries are edible but just barely. I probably won't ever eat here again and I wouldn't recommend it. The best thing I ate was my partners last onion ring. It was perfect.
author: Herschell L.

description: A great place for a good burger. For the beef burgers, they serve Niman ranch beef. A large selection of non-traditional burgers--veggie, turkey, and other hot sandwiches. Friendly and fast service make this place my favorite burger joint and among the tops for cheap eats.
author: Micki S.

description: Decent burger, but nothing special. The bun was light and insubstantial. The toppings were standard. The burger itself tasted too charbroiled; like they added liquid smoke or something. The burger was cooked to order (medium in my case) but not quite juicy enough. The fries were not too greasy, but didn't have enough potato flavor.
author: Yogi B.

description:
3.5 stars. Good score for what it's trying to be: a neighborhood burger joint.
Nothing special here; underseasoned burgers cooked to order, crisp veggies, bun sometimes soggy. Call ahead, not too expensive, accept credit, metered lot out front.
author: Matt G.

description: If in the area, hungry, Tower Burger will not let you down!  Service is fine (I think they might actually read their reviews) the burgers are Niman Ranch.  Nothing to drive for miles for, but truly dandy when you are in this part of town.  Seems clean too.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Great burgers, very fresh meat and produce, onion rings and french fries are yummy.  One of my pet peeves about most burger places is that they add too much salt to patties - these were perfect.  Cooked to order perfectly medium rare as asked.  Nice interior, great for kids, very nice service.
author: Kelly B.

description: Yay for Tower Burger! They have really good food, and get their meat from Niman Ranch which is a place where they don't feed their livestock hormones and  the intestines of other animals. I always get a chocolate shake and chicken sandwich when I'm here. The price isn't cheap but it's quality. It also isn't expensive, I'd say the burgers range from 7-9 depending on what you want on it and fries, etc.
author: Catherine M.

description: Clean, fast, friendly and good. Reminds me of a cafe you might see in the midwest on a long drive. Beef quality makes the price a really good value.
author: Steve S.

description: Good portabella mushroom burger! A tiny bit pricy, but great service and good food.
author: chris c.

description: Not sure why people rave about this place.  I've visited three times and the burgers always seemed overcooked even though I request them medium or medium rare.  Charred food is not appealing, and not good for you either.
author: Lisa F.

description: Clean location, great burgers, friendly staff.  The Niman Ranch meats are one of the reasons I buy from Tower.
author: Dong T.

description: Good burgers and the onion rings melt in your mouth. $26 bought us 2 sides of onion rings, a soda, a milk shake, a burger and a cobb salad.
author: Rachel B.

description: I really like Tower Burger! Delicious burgers (veggie burgers too), onion rings, and crispy french fries - just the way i like em!
author: Bumble B.

description:
three words: BRIE MUSHROOM BURGER. 

plus nice staff, CLEAN, quiet, lots of parking.
author: Lisa M.

description: This neighborhood has gone thru some huge changes over the years. I lived just 2 blocks form this place and it seems like there are more businesses that serve food than before. Tower Burger is a cash cow in that neighborhood from the looks of the traffic that was flowing in even on a monday night. I was with Yelper friend Larry and his wife and we all had the Tower Burger special. It was the big burger with bacon, grilled onions, cheese. Not bad for a neighborhood burger place but they need to work on freshness of when the bacon was cooked. It wasn't quite what I expected but they get a C for effort. The extra order of fries for a buck wasn't so bad either as Sparky's charges way more than most places. It's all about location my peeps when the menu burns a hole in yer pocket. Carcinogen's, start your engines...!!!! Vrrrrooooooommm....!
author: Sven S.

description: I love a good burger, before I moved to SF I lived in Greenwich Village for 25 years where my favorite burgers (I mark with a (s) for still there or (g)  for gone) were Petes Tavern (s), Jane Street Tavern (s) (REALLY the best and, Corner Street Bistro (s) (if you can deal with bar fights, mice and bugs it is very good, and of course the Daniel Bouloud's DB (ok, I only watched somebody eat it and it squirted the foie gras out of its core onto his girl's very expensive clothes, ooh la la). Anyway, I like Tower Burger, it is my current default burger joint in SF. I am open to new ideas and suggestions, so get in touch if you have a strong opinion.  It's by the old Tower Market up on top of Diamond Heights, and while you won't be bowled over by the atmospherics. you will have a solid Niman Ranch (that's pronounced ethical) experience.
author: Mark P.

description: We tried two burgers. The hamburger was incredible and the bun was really good to. The second was a BCB. The bacon was crisp with just the right amount of cheese. The fries were nice and crispy too.
author: Peter O.

description: These burgers aren't the best i think they would be better if they used some type of salt or spice in there meats. there seems to be alot of produce in your burger by the time you get to eating it. decent price but then its one of those you get for what you paid for.
author: T L.

description: Very kid friendly but skimpy on most everything. Is it too hard to buy new catsup bottles instead of refilling them forever? Excessively loud at lunch and they are still using Styrofoam to go containers. The food is good and it's a go-to when we don't want to drive to far.
author: Shawn C.

description: The food is delicious at Tower Burger.  I usually get a bacon cheeseburger with onion rings, and the fish and chips are really good.  I don't care too much for the coleslaw though.  The tuna salad is also delicious.  The restaurant is clean, and the staff is friendly.  They are always busy at lunch, but they work through it well and the quality of food does not change.
author: Trina R.

description:
Good, quick neighborhood joint.  Phone in an order and you can pick up in 5 minutes!!

Favorites are the Chicken Cobb Salad and the Paris Chicken Sandwich.  Would love it if they'd add some chicken tenders for the little ones.

Very family friendly.
author: chini l.

description: great burgers and fries. My only complaint is the  refilled  ketchup bottles that say DO NOT REFILL on them. Some don't even have labels anymore they have been wiped down so many times. My advice is get packets.
author: ron W.

description: I am conveniently located to the Tower Burger, but I almost never consider this place when I'm looking for my burger-fix.  This place has been around for 6+ years and there is nothing outstanding about its service, (and quality, for that matter) that would bring me back no more than twice a year.  Is it me, or is the "Neiman Ranch Beef" a little on the bitter side?  As for the fries, I'm actually looking for a potato that delivers a superb crunch and moist texture on the inside.  Their fries are just plain fried potatoes.  Tower Burger is your average burger joint.  I would give three stars for being average, but their meat is bitter.
author: Eric T.

description: Good hot dogs and burgers but TERRIBLE service. Beware of the beyond bitchy staff. They never get my order right and sometimes FORGET my order when it's to go. And it's way too expensive. Please do not give this place your service.
author: Martina B.

description:
I used to get take-out or go eat at this place all the time, but agree with some of the other postings that it has deteriorated recently.  They used to be efficient but friendly, but now they're just kinda mean:

Me: "I'd like a diet Co..."
Lady at Counter:  "1.75!"

Hm.

The burgers are still pretty good, but nowadays I kinda brace myself for the stinging service, like a gauntlet I have to run in order to earn my burger.

Makes ya kinda just want to go to In-N-Out instead, huh...
author: Travelin G.

description: I used to live down the street from Tower Burger, I can say with confidence that I took it for granted. This is simply the best burger you'll find in the Twin Peaks area...don't even bother trying to prove me wrong. Tower is family owned an operated by an extremely friendly and polite group of people. Both the restaurant and kitchen are always clean as a whistle, along with their delicious food. They use high quality Niman Ranch beef in all of their burgers, so eat with complete confidence. Don't be cornered into the burger though...I've never been disappointed with anything from Tower (except the gilled cheese...but it's a grilled cheese). I still have friends that drive across SF just to get a burger from Tower...so take the journey. I promise you won't be disappointed.
author: Jerry A.

description: I'm a big fan of this solid burger place.  Its a great setting for a casual meal if you have a large group or kids.
author: Gregory T.

description: When we don't feel like cooking, we head up to Tower Burger for , what we think, are the best tasting burgers in town.  Great quality meat, buns not soggy and the best fries!  Wash it down with a milkshake made from Mitchell's ice cream!  If you're not into the meat thing, they have other menu choices, too.
author: suzanne l.

description: Been going here frequently the last couple years. Great tasty burgers and shakes. Went here after I bombed my GRE's to cheer myself up--it worked. Chocolate shake + some burger = fine dining!
author: Re J.

description: A regular Tower Burger-ite until now, on a visit last week, the 'kids' were running the show..first batch of fries were a wet grease fest, which is not the norm.I rooted around on my plate for some non soaked fries and then went to the to the counter to ask for another batch, the young lady looked at me like I was crazy and then dumped the fries from my plate BACK into the fry bin to give to someone else!  Second batch worse than the first, the young man curtly informed me that this is what their fries are like, said 'we're busy so Ill just give you your money back"  and slapped $1.50 on the table. I watched the grill cook pull the fry basket from the oil and without as much as a shake or oil drain moment, dump them dripping into the fry bin. Gross! Tower Burger owners, don't leave the shop in the kids hands!
author: Charlotte F.

description: We really like Tower Burger. Burgers are great and it's a plus that they use Niman Ranch meat (if you are ordering a traditional beef burger). Fries good, onion rings could do better but that is because I like the kind that are similar to Johnny Rockets, i.e. have crumbs on them or some such thing. Anyway, I think the only drawback is the decor. Really needs a facelift. Not cozy, wouldn't want to hang out there, kinda cheap and stark. But, the food is good and it seems like a nice, family-run place.
author: Shelley F.

description: My bf and I wanted to really like this place. My bf and I really like burgers and thought that we would try this mom and pop place. When we arrived we were greeted with a smile. I ordered the Paris burger- with brie cheese and sauteed mushrooms. My bf ordered the Western burger. We had the order our onion rings on the side, extra.  We also ordered a milkshake- Mitchell's ice cream! Alas, the milkshake was watery and came in a drinking glass. It was a small glass. The weird thing about it was that my bf and I decided to share the milkshake and the server who made the milkshake decided that he would do us a favor and split the milkshake in two drinking glasses. So, both our glasses were half full when they arrived.  When I say drinking glasses, I literally mean water glasses, so they were small glasses. You know how milkshakes come in the tall glasses with whip cream and a cherry on top, with another container full of it, so you get like two full glasses, not so here. For the price of the milkshake.... so not worth it. It was so watery, it just tasted like melted ice cream. They get an extra star for having Niman ranch meat, but that really didn't make the burger taste any better. The meat was juicy, but I felt like it needed to be seasoned just a little. My bf said his burger just tasted like BBQ sauce and bun. I guess the BBQ sauce was potent. The brie cheese on my burger was tasty, I have never had this type of cheese on my burger before and I think I will try it at home when I make burgers. The best part of about our meal was when a lady came in and asked for a garden burger (which I suppose is their veggie burger) and she asked if she can have bacon on it. Huh? We got a good laugh out of that one. The restaurant is spacious and roomy. The bench seats can use a good makeover- they have electrical tape covering the holes in the seats. I would come here again, but would not make a special trip out here.
author: carebear l.
