description: YUMMY!!  We love the beef.  Occasionally my husband gets the veggie burger which he pronounces delicious as well.  Family friendly and FAST!
author: tammy m.

description: the three best three things about Tower Burger for me is (1) the location, a two minute walk from my front door. (2) Consistently good food. (3)  they got a 100 on their latest health report inspection!!!  Their portions for fries are on the small side, but enough to fill you up along with one of their niman ranch burgers. I also like their turkey burger a lot when I'm not in a red meat mood :)
author: TC C.

description: my husband suddenly had a craving for chilli-burgers and fries, so on our way home we looked up "chili burgers" and saw this place.  There was no chili burger, but you can get a regular cheeseburger with a bowl of pretty watery chili on the side.  But that's not the restaurant's fault!  The place is family-owned, and the people are nice.  Overall it was a good place, very popular, but I don't think I would go back for the price...for the 2 of us it was about $17...compared to "in-n-out", definitely prefer the latter.
author: judy j.

description: I think this is one of the better burger places I've been to in San Francisco.  Like a lot of other reviewers have been saying, the meat is great, prices are cheap, and service is really quick.  It's never really been very crowded when I've come here which is also a plus...sometimes you just don't feel like waiting 20 minutes for a burger at In-n-out which is ALWAYS completely packed.
author: Isaac W.

description: i love this place.  used to live in west portal and would regularly get their burgers (niman ranch beef), turkey burgers and salads.  excellent quality burger and good fries.  the family that owns this spot is really friendly and you can tell a lot of the families and folks that come here are regulars from the nieghborhood.
author: Ken L.

description: good food, meat from nimans ranch.  they cook their burgers on the rare side so keep that in mind, with that said well done is still very juicy and tasty.  call to order for pickup, ALWAYS 5 minutes.  really good place to go if you had a long day and not up to making dinner.  favorites are the bacon cheese burger and the California burger.  neighborhood favorite.
author: T J.

description: a lot of veg options. I was not too impressed with the garden burger. Fries are excellent. overall food is good and service is fast.
author: Beena A.

description: After a long bike ride, *anything* tastes freakin' GREAT.  Powerbars, instant oatmeal, Fresh Choice, blades of cut grass...  And so it was with Tower Burger.  I'd been here before and thought it was good but not great, a perfectly fine place to have a burger if there are no higher quality options readily available.  But on this particular occasion, with fine reddish dust covering my legs and most of my clothes, and ample amounts of lactic acid coursing through my veins, that $7 Niman Ranch Texas Burger with a small side of chili, along with an extra-cost plate of freshly cooked fries, rocked my world.  Best.  Meal.  Ever.  Like I said, on an average day, you can find a more interesting burger if you want to (for example, the Niman Ranch 1/3 pounders at my workplace's cafe are at last on par for quality, and cheaper and bigger), but you could certainly do worse than eating here.  I'd really give this restaurant 3.5 stars if I could.
author: Chuck W.

description: Kinda expensive but Good burgers, good fries, and the salads are huge!  The first time i went there, we were the only people there around 4pm.  The second time i went there i practically had to fight for a table around 6pm.  Unfortunately they don't seat you, you have order at the register and seat yourself.  The staff is not rude but not out going either,  but i think that is because they need to be tipped.  There is a tip jar near the register which most people might forget.  I guess it would help if they sat you at a table and waited on you like a regular restaurant.
author: Cherry L.

description: I eat here all the time. The food is decent, reliable, and quickly served. My husband says the fish and chips are excellent (he's from Canada, and VERY picky about this dish), and I really enjoy the burgers. I usually get the mushroom and swiss burger - it's cooked right, tasty. I am old enough to remember what beef should taste like, and sadly, I am still unable to find a truly GREAT burger, but this will do in the meantime. The side salads, by the way, are incredibly tasty and fresh, and the milkshakes are totally delicious (i don't do sugar anymore, but the chocolate shakes are awesome). I bring people here regularly, and everyone finds the quality more than acceptable. It's not a fancy place, but at least the benches along the wall are reasonably comfy (i have back problems, and need the soft support they give.). I have also always had good service here. I really like the older lady and a young man who typically takes my order. They are kind, friendly, and efficient. Haven't run into the "kids" so can't comment on that. Oh, and the onion rings! Yep, they're awesome. I prefer having less on my plate - we're all so spoiled with huge portions. No wonder this country is having an obesity problem!
author: Sophia B.

description: I do like the burgers at tower burger. They are cooked to order, come quickly, and have a 100 score for cleanliness. I guess I have a beef (yuck yuck!) about other things. First, when my child came skipping  in one day (as 3 year olds are wont to do) she slipped on the hard, stone/tile wet floor that had just been cleaned. There was no sign warning us that it was wet and therefore dangerous. The people behind the counter lifted their eyes for a second, possibly because my daughter was wailing loudly, and then they quickly looked down. This is not the way to win customers. They could have shown a bit of concern, given the child a piece of ice, apologized for the wet floor. Second, I think the price of the burgers are a tad high. Everything is al la carte, so it doesn't include a salad, fries or slaw. A bit pricey. And finally, there should be a kid meal price, or a discount if all you ask for hot dog with not bun. Please don't charge full price! You want parents to come back, right? Make us feel good about the pricing and floors!
author: annie s.

description: Honestly, I've had better food at a bowling alley... The food was not that good at all. The menu seemed interesting as it had a large variety. I chose a garden burger which actually was runny. The fries seemed bland. I think more people go here because there aren't a lot of choices in the area.
author: Michael T.
